WJ4pW1dGqwCXsb3JiYiaxQ.text: Can't rate the food here as the service or lack of service forced us to leave. Apparently going on a non weekend day and not being a regular impacts your ability to be served. Also I apparently did a big no no by bringing in the last of my iced Starbucks (sorry my bad), and because I ordered water (fyi I don't drink coffee), my starbucks was an iced chai. But instead of advising me I couldn't bring my drink in (which I would have been fine with) they stand behind our booth and talk about me, my starbucks and my water request.  BTW, I finished my chai within 3 mins of entering. We waited 15 more minutes for someone to come and take our order (never happened). Wow immature much, thanks but no thanks. We left and went to BLD.

FRuh9TiNT6eyZwBIFAn67g.text: Really great spot to get some brunch! The staff is on point and so is the food.  Their Eggs Benedict is to die for.  I've been here numerous times, and feel like a move to this side of town is necessary just to be closer to the restaurant.  This place is medium in size, but offers patios seating which is enjoyable with lots of shade from the overhanging building. I recommend this place if you love breakfast and brunch!

mfqp2wbPrDxwZECQmm3EXA.text: Good breakfast. Ordered the chicken fried steak and it was really good. Slightly disappointed in the sausage gravy as there is barely any sausages in the gravy and biscuit my husband ordered. A little pricy, but still a good place to go for breakfast.

ItnMWiy2443-kxRl-lV5oQ.text: I'm not sure what happened to this place, but the quality of the food certainly has declined tremendously since the last time we were here (about six months ago).  And the prices have gone up! We have eaten here several times a year for the about the past five years.  It has never been great, but it was always decent.....until now. There were four of us.  We went for breakfast (although I ordered off of the lunch menu) and none of us were pleased with our food.  All three of the others ordered some form of pancake meal and they all said that the pancakes tasted old and that they were rubbery.  My wife's eggs were not cooked as ordered (she ordered over medium).  They were overcooked.  One of the bacon orders was undercooked and one of the others was burned.  I ordered a patty melt (I didn't feel like paying $8.50 for one biscuit with gravy!).  My patty melt   was way overcooked (very dry), the bread was almost burned and the fries were obviously frozen and they weren't even warm. The service was good.  There were probably twenty servers on duty (mostly teenagers), so that was not an issue.  I did try to find a manager, but they couldn't seem to locate anyone in charge.

wwGowNbuGfgYJNx5i8iGJg.text: Amazing biscuits and gravy. Get the sausage to top it off if you really want the best experience. All of their breakfast options are very good, from scramblers to more traditional meals. Service has always been top notch, tables are clean, and very family friendly. My first and only choice if I want to go out for a tasty breakfast!

SRWrsKSyZTErZTgS3VJ3Wg.text: This is right by my house and is my favorite local breakfast spot.  The food is great the staff is great.  They have homemade strawberry jam for their great biscuits.  Give it a try and you'll be happy about it.

enDkiH1qDd2gjOts64-KXQ.text: Best breakfast I have had in a very long time. The food was fresh and obviously prepared by caring hands. The staff and service was above and beyond. Watchi,g the staff interact with other patrons made me excited to make this a new regular stop. There are a lot of establishments in the area that could come by here and take some notes. Great job all around.

s5A0j1HpfUzzne76DcMoew.text: Great service and great food. I had the house made hash and hubby had the avocado benedict. Both were delicious and the jam and biscuits were off the charts!

8lt0MRrccn4TuD7FzJl2RA.text: This Cafe is way over rated and over priced.  Gravy is terrible and the way the food is put on the plate is disgusting.  Will never go back, they do not hold a candle to HOOSIERS!!

m3ZNXU1MumwHTHBFsBfRdA.text: When they first opened they were terrific.  My husband and I have been here at least 7 times, usually on a Sunday when they are horribly busy.  The last two times we were there the food left much to be desired.  I usually order the Joe's scramble, and the first time around it came out lukewarm, the bacon was not cooked properly and it just didn't taste good.  I figured it was a fluke or maybe the normal cook was sick or something.  We went last weekend and I ordered a biscuits omelete and my food was cold.  The only good on the plate was the toast, which was not toasted but heated, and the jam.    Again, they were not busy.   The bus boy checked on us more than our waiter Jeremy.  I was extremely disappointed in the food and service.  On check-out, I asked the hostess how we would check to see what our rewards balance was as I wanted to see if we could apply to our bill, and she looked at me and said "I have no idea".  We won't be back.

CGPGKgFvSNSAfW4AN8C4Mg.text: Don't bother.  My husband and I tried the new Tempe location yesterday.  We arrived about a half hour before closing and were the only customers.  While I get that the employees probably want to get out of work as quickly as I do when it's time to leave work, in a restaurant I expect to get the same experience near closing time as the person who came at opening time.  The iced tea containers were being emptied and if we had wanted to sit on the patio under the umbrellas -- forget it -- the umbrellas were taken down and by the time we got our food we had watched an employee run a cable through all of the tables and chairs and lock them up tight.  The food was just okay, and rather pricey I thought.  I can go to the diner down the street and get far more food for half the price.  My Hollandaise sauce was rather lumpy, and the red potatoes "with great seasoning" were nothing special.

AwewJ4ZxOtA-3M-cBrXl3g.text: Really good homemade tasting food. Pancakes were so light and fluffy and yummy. I would say the same prices as the ihops junk but waaay better. I use to go to the good egg but no longer this is my breakfast spot now

QsaL3B9AtS8wRbRnc3J3-Q.text: When this opened across the street from my house, I was stoked. Finally a breakfast joint in my neighborhood! It was nice and clean, friendly and prompt service, and great food. The only thing I can say is that I was hoping for the best biscuits and gravy I've ever had, and they fell short a bit on the gravy. Even still, I've gone here a million times already, and will continue to...

NoAPvHYHjX5ZM_7ZNLJe_w.text: Tried to eat here at 11am this morning....not able to. Waited 1 hour and 15 minutes and only got served our drinks. Told it would be yet another 10 or more minutes before we would be served. Manager offered to pick up the check if we stayed, but we we on our way somewhere else and couldn't wait any longer. Too bad food going past us looked like it was good. Might try going back at an earlier time. Until then, and until service improves, I can't give a great score.

2jyzZ4MWcbVBl_fydCUV9Q.text: The food here is consistently delicious! Make sure to come hungry as the portions are extra large. The Service here is always friendly, efficient and attentive without hovering. If you come mid morning on the weekend, expect a wait as they are very busy. Early morning and late morning the wait is not too bad. We have been here for breakfast many, many times and for lunch a handful of times. I have yet to have a meal that wasn't wonderful! If you have yet to try this breakfast gem, you don't know what you are missing!

zkqjaOMvsNxRpsUCx6jXaw.text: I really want to love this place.  The menu is amazing and the food is great,  but each time I have gone, my food has been cold.  Not sure if it's because my wife's omlette takes a while to cook or if they are just too busy to bring it out on time.  I'll go back and have my wife order something different and see how my food arrives.

D_TRncJSDj3pMYe5ziykVQ.text: We went in for breakfast this morning. I was pleasantly surprised. The food was great, service was quick. Our waitress was wonderful. Will definitely be back.

2E7QVRyZ0OsnI9Jf-WEm6A.text: I wish I'd has as good an experience as others with this cafe.  My bacon was burned and the coffee smelled and tasted burned as well.  This cafe is priced higher and the food quality is lower than other breakfast eateries in the area.  I certainly won't be back.

GEuQC8C6jMO90VjFNQBHbQ.text: Bomb! Everything's about 10 but worth it and if you don't eat it all you get 2 for 1 since it's a lot. You get a chocolate covered strawberry with your meal as a nice touch on top of that homemade jam which they should bottle and sell. I'm not a breakfast fan in general but yum!

upBuuq1XK3zgWi9iOX22YQ.text: Awesome Place.   French Toast is great. Biscuits are fluffy and taste great.  Super helpful and courteous staff.

1T034_HCP7X2rH0mzst-DQ.text: Horrible experience here! We were seated by a grumpy waitress, she seved our drinks by slamming them on the table... We had to wait longer for my breakfast because the cook didn't get my order right. The sausage came out when we were done eating and was dry and gross. ..my cinnamon roll came out with the to go boxes... couldn't get refills on drinks. .  Waitress forgot our check and was annoyed when we asked for it. The chicken fried steak is extremely small... and just a heads up a side of the dry cold sausage was $4.19...I will never return to this restaurant

GvbJ6juaNrbwKxcay7nF7w.text: The most amazing cinnamon rolls ever. They're huge, super soft, melt in your mouth, served hot topped with icing and butter. Must try!  I also tried the corned beef hash. I was surprised to find that it was real shredded corned beef. I had their red potatoes on the side and they were absolutely delicious. I dunno why they even bother offering hashbrowns, the red potatoes are where it's at!  Service was friendly and quick, no mistakes. Priced were fair, about $30 for two people.

fh-lNgakn26tHfQaUqhqkw.text: Their food is good but service is going severely downhill. Used to like this place. The wait time is long, while plenty of to go orders are constantly being filled, which makes the sit down customers have to wait longer. There is no excuse when poor service comes up, the women at the counter just state "We know, it's gotten bad".

wbUwQzn-o2EzkYsq0XaXCw.text: Awesome! 3 visits, 3 different meals, all 3 I would gladly eat again!! Waffle was crispy on the outside & fluffy on the inside. Comes with meat & eggs, sausage links were good. Chicken fried chicken was delicious. Country Benedict was also delicious. Hash browns cooked just right. Even the coffee is awesome. 6 or 7 other menu items I'm dying to try. Place is friendly, well run, & clean. Highly recommend!!

photos.caption: Photo of Biscuits Cafe - Chandler, AZ, United States. The inside of the restaurant.

oKzJ6MyqER9oZzdPeHeQ4g.text: Great Food Large portions Excellent Service  Had a bacon omelette tons of bacon and the homemade jam was awesome. Smooth coffee and never was empty. The people workin there hustle and make sure your food is on time. I will never go anywhere else for breakfast for now on.

9Lg-BXkWYE_Xdl2wDQl9_A.text: I cannot begin tell how how AMAZING this delightful little restaurant is. Upon walking in, the first thing you'll smell is coffee. Delicious coffee that is roasted in house and also available for purchase. The smell alone will make you glad you came. Then you'll look at the menu and be torn on what to order because it all sounds good. (Let me recommend the Almond French Toast. It's amazing!) The service is wonderful and you'll have a small army of smiling, helpful wait staff coming over to refill coffee and check on you often. When the food arrives it will look delicious and beautiful. The best part is, that no matter what you order, you'll find a chocolate covered strawberry on your plate. It's the manager's touch, and a lovely way to finish off a delicious and delightful dining experience. Highly recommend!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Biscuits Cafe - Chandler, AZ, United States. Almond French Toast with Eggs and Ham, and a complimentary Chocolate Covered Strawberry. Delicious!

1TSPdIZbJvmfn05pmhbrbg.text: Best place for burger w egg....... BREAKFAST BURGER.....Yaaaaasssssssss queeeeeeeen! Get w side of syrup ........mmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmm

JKI9HKvRioxHiRDDFdfa1w.text: My son and I ate here for the first time.  The food was really good, great service and not an empty table in sight.  Only complaint was that our table was sticky  but it was taken care of immediately.  We will be going back !

Nq08KJf_BBCRhdtIht577g.text: Solid place... I need to try a few more dishes, but very good. I was looking for a new Bfast place as I was getting sick of the same two places I always go to. A Saturday breakfast is basically a family tradition at this point.  I have the Apple chicken sausages, crispy hash browns, biscuits and eggs. Sausage was genuine...real stuff. The hash-browns were crispy and still had some good potato content and of course the biscuits were awesome... See you there next Saturday...

4Tz1ecrFBSwOwnu5mzOmVQ.text: We decided to try this place for the first time. It was just okay. Hash browns came out cold. Corned beef hash was terrible. Potatoes were crunchy and it had zero flavor. Drinks were never refilled even though server came back to check on us a couple of times. I probably won't go back until I see an improvement on food and service.

KE2nMgcjLeHgD0v1PPi33Q.text: First time here. It was okay.   The Good: Restaurant is bright and clean. Food came fast. Service was excellent from both our server and the bus staffer.  The Not-so-Good: Coffee was weak. Food was above average but just above. Extremely expensive. Omelets are all $12 and up. Biscuits and Gravy is $11 with two biscuits and an egg and bacon. Coffee was $2.50. Orange juice was $2.50 for a small glass.  I guess I just don't expect to pay $19 (before tax and tip) for scrambled eggs with ham, hash browns, two pancakes, coffee, and a small OJ.

r6UGHtgIdu4mEdbkJs2a9A.text: Service was good food came out 'hot' which is always a plus! The strawberry jelly was freshly made it actually tasted like strawberries and not sugar! Awesome!!! I would eat there again...a little off putting that the waitress kept staring at the top of my head when she would one to the table. Maybe me think is there a bird on my head and you're not telling me...BUT the food was good especially the biscuits!!!

l-BP1nHcag1rZ04enBeQlg.text: My orange juice came out warm,my eggs arrived cold and my server vanished after taking my order. Never was offered a refill on my coffee. E1zXX20cjRwXUFmBt97XQw.text: Fast and fresh breakfast! I like the simple things for breakfast sometimes and they do a great job at it. Will definitely be back.

-kp3CrhFi0NeTuUQ9duhkw.text: Went here on Saturday June 11 while visiting the Phoenix area and must say we had excellent service considering it was very busy. Hopefully the Biscuits here in Las Vegas is as good.

Today we are seated right away,  and our server was at the table in less than a minute. The food is always good. Today tried the avacodo Benedict. ..husband got the scramble special, with pumpkin pancakes  (seasonal. .yum!) Food and beverages delivered timely. .great spot.

5wyXkjtsanJ56Shx5RsFWg.text: We prefer the Dobson & Warner location. Theresa is the funniest and best waitress. We go every weekend!

nZuPd6q_Y1-7qElNLQYegA.text: The corned beef hash at this place is very good! Service was quick, food was very fresh. Fruit sides were fresh. The coffee is bland, but biscuits are light and fluffy.

e4WhGrVQ9hEHDHmlzF3N1w.text: We love this place..the service is always good, food is great, big portions. And wonderful return customer discounts

EJmLXcDpeFclLFm_Pm88XA.text: Service and food are both okay. My husband liked his roast beef dip, I thought my turkey sandwich lacked flavor. We'll go check it out again to give it another shot since it's in the area

OenTs9fccUSq1WdXL0xT0Q.text: Thought we were going to the place just called Biscuits so were a bit disappointed with no grits but the food was very good (had the benedict Florentine). Arrived at 7am on Saturday and they were still setting up and only had one waitress for the whole place. Not her fault but definitely felt the lack of an adequate number of servers.

Az5Bo4LBTgZEyoDfn3Q-rQ.text: The food is outstanding, the service is prompt and friendly, and the freezer jam is the perfect compliment to a biscuit and a hot cup of coffee.

iEYoVj01VzgaPbWfJI6f_g.text: Coffee wasn't that good, very cheap tasting. The biscuits were dry and my weren't cooked to my order. The gravy was flavorless and bacon undercooked. Maybe I had a bad chef that day but damn, was not worth it.

GHDAU5jO_Eugf4YJBfQlfw.text: New family favorite.  Breakfast on Sundays is packed, but even so they still manage to provide prompt service and excellent food. Skillet breakfast is off the charts GOOD!

C5r0e0LNikXey1tkgD-BZA.text: Great little neighborhood diner spot.  Decor and view are nothing to write home about, but what are you here for?  To be swept away by the ambiance or have breakfast/brunch.  Food portions are very large so be warned, you don't really need sides and add-ons, don't worry, you'll be full.    Servers are polite and cheerful, it's sort of server by committee rather than one committed server but they do a good job of making the rounds and making sure you have all you need.  The chicken fried steak is my favorite and pretty much everything else I've tried is very good, in all fairness though I never tried any lunch items, but I feel this is more of a breakfast place anyways, it's not as crazy crowded as other places get on weekends.  There will be a wait, but not an insane one.  Only knock on the place is the coffee, it's not bad...but its not good either.  But everything else is pretty damn good for a strip mall diner.

dZaVlmNQkMHcme5raJCIIQ.text: Wonderful gluten free waffles!  It's a smaller cafe, so I always go off peak hours.  We always have a great waitress.  My husband goes with friends at least once a week if not more frequently.  Parking... it's a shopping center, so it is what it is.  The bank in the plaza has a fit even when they aren't open.  I wouldn't call it patio seating as only a few tables... they have some work to do there it's a nice try.  I like the decor and real maple syrup when you eat in.  When you get it to go, it's Mrs Butterworths.

xpUOiUDc7lfkTs2eFhHQqA.text: So Far the ONLY thing I didn't like was the Huevos Ranchero it didn't taste anything like any kind of huevos rancheros I ever had it was more like enchilada sauce this needs to be improved on Besides that I love the place

7LWdXkkL38cVpamflpVdiw.text: My party of 6 last Sunday and called ahead to get a table. The table was not ready when we arrived. They were swamped.  I had the chicken Fajita omelet and it was delicious, but they forgot my pancakes. They seemed understaffed and overwhelmed. But all of my party seemed to enjoy the food and we did get a table in the corner, so it was not too loud. We did have to wait over 25 minutes for our food after ordering, but I know that is somewhat normal when you have a large table. Kudos to the staff as they tried to cover one another, which is something I appreciate.

VpD4sXCHr2bjfEqOaP5FAA.text: Not sure what all the hype is about. I ordered huevous rancheros. It was cold and tasted like it came out of a can. I ordered crispy potatoes, they came crispy on the outside and barely warm on the inside. Not exactly what I was thinking. We also had the cinnamon roll, barely had any cinnamon ( like I couldn't taste it at all) and way too much lemon in the icing.  All that said I will be back because the service was top notch, they listened to everything I said, took the cold meal off our bill and the manager came out apologized also.

p1Kepo1hwbamrVfoYoolzg.text: The food was pretty good, I had the chorizo omelet and my wife enjoyed her meal as well. The cinnamon rolls are huge, but they put WAY too much icing on them. The main issue we had was the lack of service. Once our food was dropped off we didn't see our waitress until she brought the bill.  Then we waited for some time trying to get a to-go box and drink refills. We figured we'd ask another server, but the only person we saw was the busboy. I'm hoping this isn't the norm.

bTnSYD5YqlONTec9CGFh3Q.text: Just so-so at the Chandler AZ location. Double the cost of a Waffle House , and half as good.

tHbFEQlXaeIfO1qEiS-rIg.text: Food was good. Price seemed ok. I like ihop better. I didnt like sitting on the wooden park benchs they had inside. But, the waitress was nice and it had a nice vibe.

G8uN2g6y2Wan9sWsYP5-aQ.text: I love coming to this cafe but they seem disorganized and slow.  The  food is good but seems expensive for the serving size.  I hope they get organized quick or I will have to find another cafe.

_Eo3zoMQHUrLOazJP3RWKg.text: Here I was thinking "yay a new favorite breakfast spot" until I crunched into something alien in my red potatoes. Not sure if it was eggshell or glass or sand. But it ended my desire to take another bite immediately. So disappointed because I was really enjoying the eggs Benedict prior to that.

CccoNcKPHJMfQDPUI42zfg.text: They must have hired all new staff!! This morning staff was horrible !!!!! I was walked pass three times before anyone acknowledged me. The server was not friendly and acted as if she was offended she had to talk to me. This by far has been the worse service ever and I've been coming here since they've opened. I ended up not ordering and left with much disgust.

KxrLbl9W3xbJYGekCuRPeA.text: This place has a great breakfast menu & lots of choices. The bacon is so crispy and good! Their wheat bread is delicious and I believe made in house!! The service on the  patio was pretty slow for not being that busy..

_DGvDPIOw0777myKPcmfKg.text: Nestled into the corner of a small shopping center, Biscuit's Cafe can be easily missed if you're on the run and not really looking for a spot to sit and eat. But to those who know about it and those hungry enough to check it out are rewarded with large portions and good service.  On a sunny Friday morning, the wife and I were looking for a place to have breakfast while visiting friends in the Chandler/Tempe Area. A quick Yelp search uncovered this little place nearby and decided to give it a try. The cafe is small enough to miss, but does have outdoor seating if needed and a decent sized dining room.   The prices are fair and not over the top, with both breakfast and lunch offerings ranging in the 7-11 dollar range. For the amount of food that you receive, I'd say that it's a good deal. I had the meat lover's breakfast with pancakes and she had the corned beef hash with biscuits. The food was good, but nothing overly astonishing. The corned beef hash was obviously home made, which did make it special, but the meat to potato ratio seemed to be a bit meat heavy (which to some, wouldn't be a bad thing).  The service we received was attentive, and friendly, although a little sparse, having to flag down our server more than once to get some beverage refills. A manager also visited our table to see how we were doing.  Overall, it's a nice little place to have breakfast. The prices are decent and the atmosphere is great for what it is. Food is good, but average.

photos.caption: Photo of Biscuits Cafe - Chandler, AZ, United States. Corned beef hash with biscuits and eggs

RWdNgME4O_3M7jHgtzesDA.text: The staff was friendly but I'm wildly disappointed with the food. I got my to-go order and it was just a bunch of mush.

photos.caption: Photo of Biscuits Cafe - Chandler, AZ, United States. This was $10...worth it?

7e5rwxmv5NnHaF3qKlhXfQ.text: We prefer this location to the one on Alma School..patio seating is much better. Food is usually very good. My only complaint is they don't clean the outside tables well, if we go there for breakfast we usually have to ask them to wipe off the table and chairs . That should be a job for someone when the restaurant opens, especially now that the weather is getting nicer.

_3jU__d-cRjs4PaRdoZTgg.text: The food and service were OK. However the buttermilk pancakes were not very flavorful. Also both my pancakes and sausage were over done on the outside. They must have had the griddle too hot.   The sausage gravy is very good though. All together, my wife and I like Crackers Cafe much better.

b8f4aarvd4HDbpj3lSRDcQ.text: Love this cafe! Now one of my favorite lunch/breakfast stops. Portions are large enough to share or box some up for later in the day. Have visited here for breakfast & lunch. The Reuben sandwich was delicious, not greasy or fatty. Shared the veggie omelet with a friend and substituted the cinnamon french toast as a combo dish, was especially thrilled the server did not respond with "sorry we don't substitute" - we both enjoyed the food & the service. Coffee is good too, had a variety of creamers.

PZ-Z9yl1EkemXm-3V1aOHQ.text: This location is right by a LA fitness, so the setup of the restaurant is kind of awkward. There are tables outside on what would be considered a patio, but it isn't really a patio as much as it is the front of the building. So when you're eating outside, everyone who is waiting for a table is in the same area as you and gets to watch you as you eat. Our server only dealt with us when she took our food order and dropped off the check. Someone else brought our drinks, food, and to -go boxes. My boyfriends french toast was dry and my eggs were ice cold. Luckily my pumpkin pancakes were excellent.  We could have sent them back, but it took us over 20 minutes to get our food and we never could find our server, so we just ate what we had. Pretty sure it isn't worth visiting again.

FLNshyS-3tBJFSw_dax9ow.text: Great breakfast! The cinnamon roll french toast and meat lovers omelette are top notch! Biscuts and fresh jam are terrific.

photos.caption: Photo of Biscuits Cafe - Chandler, AZ, United States. Great cinnamon french Toast!

__n_HNFdieo8sWhwe0pqUw.text: Good coffee and rye toast, but my eggs were under cooked, sausage over cooked and the gravy was so salty I could not take more than one bite.  Even my waiter said he thought it was too salty, YET, even after complaining not only to the waiter but also to cashier there was absolutely no offer of credit.  Not good customer service.  As you can guess I will never be a customer at the Surprise location, let alone any other.

E7nsBTI3YWqzCLuenv08sw.text: Best breakfast place!!  The waffles and bacon are crispy and the juice is always fresh and cold.

9jFgijJgz2_VrtV1ppnStw.text: I like breakfast but never understood why simple and quick prep ingredients like it, can be charged so expensively. So I don't go out for it often. But this day was an exception. Was happy with BC's portions and more modest use of sugar in their sweet items. Service was friendly and quick. Got the "eggs your way" combo and was plenty for next day leftovers. Taste overall was average. Ham steak a bit dry and same with eggs. Husband's chicken fried steak came out piping hot which was a plus. Overall avg. but for the value (portion:quality:price) may be back when I'm in the mood for breakfast outing.

bx0IwjMgxX-RhP2Pj3pbgQ.text: I am really not a big breakfast person.  When I do eat breakfast, I like to get a belgian waffle and its amazing how many restaurants can't get it right.  Well, at Biscuits Cafe, they do get it right.  You can either get a plain belgian waffle, one with fruit and whip cream, or you can get a combo, a waffle, eggs and some sort of meat-bacon or sausage.  I also like that the restaurant is clean-very clean.   Waiters, waitress, waitpersons? whatever-they have all been pretty friendly as well.

QY-22faZr70YO2M9Vulveg.text: Generous portions, large menu. Good service. Been here a handful of times, and have not been disappointed! Katy is our favorite waitress.

eG2uW5xLUArK25vUj_sILg.text: Amazing service. I had beef brisket Benedict and it was definitely not vegan or vegetarian but so delicious

ArOu1VEh0qzVg5WTBnhECg.text: Today we arrived at 8:40 or so. Very busy - Very noisy.  Immediately tried to seat us right at the service station.  Waited 20 min or so to order. The order then took about 45 min. to arrive.  Very understaffed.  When we asked the server if they were short staffed (thinking this was the reason for the poor service) we were told  "O,  No !"  Of course not.  No auto coffee refills, or water.  Others who ordered after us were served before us.   At one point the server asked us how everything was -- didn't even look at the table to see we had no food.  Finally after complaining (and asking for a second cup of coffee)  she gave some excuse about not putting the order in the right place.  Been there a number of times, but I will not be back as there are lots of other places you can go in the area.

8Zjw69KiND77TN3Q3GOnRg.text: Chicken fried steak and freshly baked cinnamon rolls were delicious! Great service! We'll be back!

9czeFvZRdM0I5k4S9JPenA.text: Decided to stop in for breakfast since we were heading to Chandler. We arrived about 10am on Saturday and while it was busy we got seated right away. I had the chipped beef w/2 eggs over easy, crispy hashbrown and two biscuits. I had decided to go outside of my box with this order. When it arrived my eggs were over cooked as my yolk wasn't runny at all and that is my favorite part. I was expecting some gravy over the chipped beef as it was a tad dry without it so I asked for a side of that which definitely helped. The hashbrowns were cooked crispy like I like but the best part of my breakfast was the two biscuits that I put gravy on one and the jam on the other. My boyfriend ordered the waffles with sausage links. He said it was good but I could tell it didn't stand out like other places. Service was very good but I think we will try other options around the valley before really coming back.

YUTkYH70a6SqMdkUz0201g.text: Great food, great service and great prices. Never disappointed when I come for breakfast, brunch, lunch or dinner.

3gwJGbogoGRQ2Y4DvNiotg.text: Biscuits were great the gravy was just okay but the service and red potatoes were excellent.

ixsbgjsc01RJvQVg1nZidg.text: This is my favorite place in the valley to goo for breakfast or brunch. Good is seasoned to perfection,  portions are large.  You will leave there very satisfied.

3HcFqSEuoLC2MEtUHCPyYQ.text: It was a little below average for me. If the name of your restaurant is biscuits, you better serve some pretty darn good biscuits, and they were not that good.   We chose to sit outside on a beautiful October morning and were seated right away. I had my infant with me, but they had no sling for his carrier (and apparently their high chairs do not convert to accommodate a carrier either). Therefore, my 3 month old had to sit in his carrier on the ground while I ate; I watched him like a hawk because there were ants close by. Not a good start.  My girlfriend had been here before and said the food was delicious (she doesn't have a good track record for recommending restaurants). I ordered one biscuit and gravy off the a la carte menu. The waiter said it came with 2 sides??? What? It's a la carte; I don't want a whole meal!?!  Obliging, I picked links and red potatoes, again the red potatoes were raved about by my friend. I'm going to stop taking her suggestions. My plate came out and 3/4 of it was covered by lukewarm red potatoes. Actually, my whole plate was lukewarm; very disappointing. The biscuit had a weird spongy texture, not a good biscuit. I can make better Bisquick biscuits at home. The gravy was ok, not horrible, but nothing to brag about. And, the potatoes, I just didn't get it. I poked around at them hoping they would magically turn into something that tasted good, but I left them on my plate just as they came.  Would I come back to give them a second chance? Absolutely not. There was not one thing on my plate that was worth the splurge. I make better biscuits and gravy at home. Why would I go out to eat mediocre food?

QPo2jmpS_0LxrnekBiVKwg.text: Great biscuits and a great breakfast. Their eggs Benedict are wonderful. Just wish they were open for dinner

2NWmJqTv7hcZK8Rybd9HZw.text: Well, what to say about this place...the food was okay.  I really could have done the same thing at home and it would have tasted better and wouldn't have been so blah.  The one good thing was the cinnamon rolls...we took a half dozen home with us and they were absolutely amazing.  Also the prices were a little high for the food you got.  I might go back for the cinnamon rolls but for just a general breakfast, I'll most likely go somewhere else.

GxxTHxTfG0uM2RFsDqlYtg.text: Just had breakfast egg over easy biscuits and grave and bacon.  Eggs were practically raw.   I said I couldn't eat them. Whites weren't cooked. Sent them back for over medium. Whites were still partly raw. I wasn't going to send them back again.  Somebody needs to teach the cook how to make eggs. The gravy for the biscuit wasn't very good either. Not what you'd expect biscuits and gravy to taste like.  I think I maybe saw 2 pieces of sausage in the gravy.  Don't think I'll becoming back again. The place has gone downhill.

IABR5FtktW1K9RCdge-Sjw.text: I have been here twice recently and enjoyed both times. I had the avocado eggs Benedict and it is cooked very nicely... the service is good. I would definitely recommend breakfast from here. On a side note, the water glasses are huge which I love so even when they are busy you never run out of water. Nice little spot!!

6CytepmTAf0J6rBzjL33nQ.text: Probably my favorite brunch spot in the Chandler area. Me and my friends usually go here after a long night at a concert whenever something is happening at Rawhide. I definitely recommend the half hot cocoa, half coffee drink!

XYqqEDSjXM5qwOG2rhYGJA.text: We normally LOVE Biscuits, but our experience yesterday may cause us to never go back.   The restaurant was busy, so the initial wait to be greeted at the table is understandable, but after that....   We ordered two adult meals, 1 kids meal and a side of eggs and the only item that came out correct was the side of eggs. My sons meal had hash browns when he asked for red potatoes (twice), my wife didn't get the egg whites she ordered, got bacon instead of sausage and pancakes instead of toast. The server was apologetic, but at no time did a manager come by our table to talk with us about all the mistakes. We had to ask for our check 3 times and when it came no compensation for all the mistakes was offered.   I paid the 30+ dollars and decided we'd just have to find a new breakfast place for the future.

Heq9AqPySpxLBVPG_2QHAQ.text: yum yum yum!  My aunt suggested this place because she loves good breakfast. What she didn't say was that she loves biiiiiig breakfasts.  Everything on the menu sounded really tasty, especially the items our server suggested. Issue though - I alone cannot eat 4 eggs/pancakes/hash browns/etc, nor can my mom. Thankfully though Biscuits Cafe has "smaller" portioned meals too. Funny, she and I ordered the exact same thing and both of us couldn't finish our meals - 2 eggs, sausage patties, hash browns, and biscuits. My mom looked in heaven with the biscuits, they reminded her of her mom's homemade biscuits. I would love to have some of those shipped to Indiana!

7Y4k9Up6FwFwxdzSipAumA.text: Great food and service. A bit on the pricey side for breakfast but will return for the quality.

Y3SCsp_lL8pjvA0NEY9zIQ.text: I always love this place.  The omelets are amazing, pancakes are fluffy, and bacon is crispy...every time!  This is the perfect "traditional" meets "modern" breakfast spot. The reason I give this review 4 stars rather than 5 is because I think the prices are a little high.  $40 for breakfast for 3 is pretty high, but we keep coming back. I would recommend to anyone interested in a hearty portion for breakfast.

e5_h4vzq2GA8xCHj0txFwg.text: I really liked biscuits before but after the horrible lunch we had the other day has changed my opinion.  I feel they change cooks often so the consistency doesn't exist. Staff is always excellent but I can not say the same about the food.

HsqFkayO8QqJ2ACNCLrVfg.text: I generally do not eat breakfast but decided to go for it on my birthday.  What a great find.  Had the Avocado Benedict and added ham to it.  Food cooked to perfection and my server, Theresa was just great.

O-GpSnTYvsCEvcpbXjNxuA.text: Great breakfast this Saturday morning. Over easy eggs cooked just right, crispy bacon, and golden brown has browns. My brother had eggs with a blue berry pancake and bacon. We both enjoyed the food, atmosphere, and the friendly servers. Perfect breakfast spot.

fXhFJ7IGbrMIrUWWZVp4og.text: Decent experience. I don't understand why Yelp asks you to keep writing long reviews...?

r0lV8pNT9xr1SltyIB5T7Q.text: Excellent food jam is awesome! Our server alissa  was great! We will be back. place is clean!

eH3S_w65l4WVy7m44QKPzA.text: For some reason I expected Biscuits Cafe to be a lot better than it was.  Woke up early Sunday morning to have breakfast with my mother and we decided to try Biscuits Cafe. I heard tons of good reviews about their food. Mom decided to try their infamous Hollandaise brisket breakfast special and I had their country omelette with red potatoes and biscuits. The Hollandaise breakfast needed to be seasoned more. It just wasn't that good. My omelette was pretty runny and my potatoes were underdone. The biscuits, that the place is named after, were good but not memorable. The staff was pleasant and the atmosphere was clean and warm. I just wish the food was better. I definitely think Yoli's Cafe is better with the food and service.

RVEPENfj1t0BVxvOCAYckQ.text: Little has changed I'm sorry to say!  They gave us a $5 discount for her birthday. We ordered the same meal for my wife (chicken fried chicken special breakfast and I had their new sandwich, beef brisket dip with fries and a pickle.  The meat had little flavor other than a smoky one and the au jus had very little taste.  Wife's hash brown had a nice flavor but needed to be browned more, my fries were meh. Noticed that her chicken fried chicken was $1.60 more since our last visit 2 1/2 years ago, had a nice taste, still small.  A 2 1/2 star meal, please remind me if I ever think about returning :(

4pZ6NqdyCoKXLWso8322FQ.text: Good choice for a breakfast place that doesn't get as crowded as other places.  Not so trendy, maybe, or just because it's right next to LA Fitness and most people don't want to get caught stuffing their mouths right next to the gym?  The food is good and the portions are ginormous like other breakfast places. I do enjoy their home-made jam (which they sell). The raspberry one was amazing.   Has a patio, so that's good.

hNhgzBQkdKsKGQNeWUR8Jg.text: My daughter and I went for breakfast this morning and this is a cute place with a nice vibe. They don't know how to cook eggs and the waitress we had never bothered to come by and check on us she could tell I wasn't very happy but never inquired as to why. When we got up to the register the cashier asked how everything was and I told her the eggs were way over cooked and our waitress never bothered to check on us... That was a waste of words because she acted as though Ijust said nothing at all.  The food was just so so and I wouldn't recommend going back. This was a waste of time and money poorly spent

BBqBby50mj1TmPKd4jNMMg.text: Our first time but not our last. The biscuits are fantastic and so was the gravy. We also had the cinnamon roll French toast which was great. The place is small but the service was big.

N8hKjpmtt4yZOvxnfG9ePQ.text: Very good breakfast. Biscuits are yummy and red potatoes very tasty. Served with lots of bacon

hnscBEHBadM6ItTN66Mp8A.text: Came with friends after church one Sunday in January after searching in this area which is unfamiliar to us. Found this great place (through yelp) and loved the food, service was great!  The only problem was we couldn't remember the name or where it was located...until yesterday. So glad we know now and we'll definitely return!

lBJjLHCtWpTAhR69BrIoaQ.text: Love, love, love this place!! Chicken Apple Sausage is second to none, pancakes are fluffy and HUGE, eggs are always done right. Cafe mocha is a lovely change from the standard coffee, and the cinnamon rolls are ginormous! The decor and service are old school in all the right ways - looks like home and the treat you like family. I am NEVER disappointed coming in here, even on busy days.

02Y7Sa01v_TCsl-V218AXA.text: Back at my favorite breakfest spot...There food is great..Service is always top notch..All employees are friendly and outgoing..Prices are good..portions are good..And the bonus is its close to my house..They are only open till 2pm which works well for me since I work nights and my morning starts around 11:30am.Try it out sometime...way better then them hole in the wall dinners..Foods alway freshly made and tastes great

MsVfboBoxWd7iOrnky4Kmg.text: Super delicious food!  Very generous portions.  Wait staff was very attentive, especially Theresa.  Definitely will be back.

vD1YE9vEGDBl31GT3k3zjA.text: "If you don't eat all your vegetables there won't BE an economic recovery!" said a frustrated mom to her son right as our group passed her table one recent summer afternoon for a quick lunch. Or at least that's what it sounded to ME like she was saying. The server sat us in right about the middle of the restaurant and my seat faced the window where I could see the Dobson road traffic passing by. I studied the menu looking for something to catch my eye and appetite. I settled on the BBQ Western Bacon Burger. Portions were huge and you get a lot of bang for the buck. The burger was alright but nothing that makes me want to come running back over here for another one. One of my dining companions got the Classic Club sandwich for $10.49 and holy fecal matter, batman! That sandwich was huuuuuuuge! I think that one was definitely meant for sharing. Heck, you could probably feed a family of four with that as long as nobody in that family requires two seats for air travel. But that's a secret for now apparently. The place wasn't packed when we came by. Not sure if this place that once housed the slightly overpriced Vietnamese restaurant Anise (which probably couldn't compete with the two cheaper Vietnamese joints right across the street in the Lee Lee's mall) will make it into our lunch rotation or not. I do know one thing - if I find myself starving and low on cash, the Classic Club is definitely an awesome value meal!!

Eha5awtnCA_z2jJRzqW5Hw.text: Just OK. I had eggs, sausage links, toast, and a cinnamon roll with coffee. The eggs and sausage were bland. The strawberry jam with the toast was very good. The cinnamon roll was nice and soft, but had kind of a funny aftertaste. The coffee was OK. There were assorted flavors of coffee creamers at the table, not my thing as I prefer half and half, but good if you're into that. The wait staff was very friendly and helpful, but perhaps a bit over attentive. Can't say I'd go there as a destination, but I wouldn't object if someone suggested it.

wuk0AqH3dPn4tDJt5F6bmA.text: I live right around the corner from this new brunch spot.  Finally tried it and it's my new favorite!  Very friendly staff and yummy food!  I love their biscuits and their homemade strawberry jam is to die for.  Haven't had a meal I didn't like yet.  The only thing I did not like was the giant glob of butter served on the cinnamon roll.  This is personal preference though, so I certainly do not fault for that!

vkRL5zt92R3BMEvrjDzrLQ.text: We were really excited to try this new breakfast place, but never got the chance to eat there.  We arrived on a busy Saturday morning, and joined the line to seated.  There were plenty of employees and places to sit,  but no one was acting as host/hostess.  We really should of cut our losses there, but we waited.  We finally were seated, and  for 10 minutes with no server, or anyone acknowledging us.  It was strange.   As we looked around only 1 table out of 10 or so had food.  We gave up and left.  I am not sure if the staff wasn't trained properly or there was no manager directing people. There was a bunch of staff but they weren't really helping anyone.  We really wanted to try this place out, but the lack of service made it not possible.

r5kuIjSNl82exGLhnKXj-g.text: My family and I had breakfast at this place for the first time today. I first noticed how clean and how nicely the place was decorated. We were promptly seated and greeted and were served our drinks all within a few short minutes. Our server was very pleasant. The food came out quickly, it was all very delicious. My most FAVORITE part of this visit was the coffee! YUM! It was some of the best coffee I have ever been served outside of a coffee shop. They even serve it in better than average coffee mugs! I highly recommend this place! We all left very satisfied!

_z0G1mVB_vQmT2aNqfZXKA.text: This was our first visit to this restaurant.  It was very crowded, but we only had to wait about 5 minutes for a table.  The wait staff moves fast in that place.  The service was quick with water & coffee and very friendly.  It took 9 minutes for our food to arrive once we placed our order.  That was great service with how busy the restaurant was.  I gave it 3 stars because although the service was 5 stars, the food quality was not.  My potatoes were extremely salty and my omelet was bland.  The amount of food on the plate was enormous though!  My husband said he felt like he was on an episode of man vs. food!  I really wish all restaurants had servers like this restaurant!!

OzEO0Bt7XUxQotUDADKTjw.text: Great service and atmosphere,  but the prices are on the high end and the food is so so at best. I got huevos rancheros and it was covered in some kind of chili. The eggs benedict is also slathered in sauce or gravy depending on which one you choose. I may try it again and get something else.... but probably not for these prices. The service and atmosphere are the reasons to come here.

Pdvj-X8crQmU-SfSWs-4lQ.text: There should be a zero star option. This was the worst meal I have had in a long time! Service was mediocre (maybe the only reason to give one star) and we had to wait 35 minutes for our food. When the food finally arrived the sight on our plate was almost unexplainable. My eggs,  supposedly sunny side up, were raw seeping with a clear goo as if straight out of the shell. My wife's eggs were also raw as if straight out of the shell. My pancakes were so undercooked that I hope the grill was malfunctioning so Biscuits has a semblance of an excuse for destroying an easy and common breakfast dish. My wife's french toast was also still covered in raw egg batter leaving an undesired shine and soggy texture. In conclusion, the experience was horrific and pathetic especially because Biscuits is a breakfast/lunch establishment. It would have been nice to have a manager to speak to about the horrific experience, for the very least, he/she could ensure it would not happen to other guests, but there was not a manager on site at the time. For Biscuits sake, we hope the single bite we consumed does not make us sick.

sEtM8jjM7ut9kDs5XAL0Fg.text: If you're in the mood for great home-style breakfast, this is the place to go!  It's my new favorite breakfast hangout.  Try the chicken fried steak... It's off the hook!

C9jS65_7hTCSrbI7tjzSBw.text: Best breakfast place in Chandler!! Hands down, this place has the BEST pancakes. I took my kids here a few days ago and everyone loved it - pancakes, omelet, and French toast. Service was very friendly. They have a nice patio that will be great in the fall. We will be back!

JmHRMWxu0r6_HC480W9hxA.text: We had been anxiously awaiting the opening of Biscuits Cafe as there are very few breakfast/lunch places that are worth going to in this area. We were not disappointed! The space is roomy and inviting and the staff is friendly and knowledgable. We started with coffee, which was hot and very tasty.  The menu is extensive and covers all of the breakfast and lunch favorites anyone could ask for. The prices are moderate averaging around $10 per person for breakfast entrees but which may seem a bit expensive but once your food arrives, you will know why! My wife ordered the chorizo omelette which was awesome and huge, served with an equally huge portion of perfectly cooked hash browns and two very large, impeccably toasted sourdough slices. I ordered the biscuits and gravy which is accompanied by two eggs and your choice of bacon, sausage or ham. I ordered my eggs over medium and the bacon. The eggs were a bsolutely perfect and the bacon was thick and tasty. Give it a try, you won't be disappointed!

qOzVIjCeY0cgwsQ8gCnyXw.text: Very good! About as good as a breakfast joint can be. Service was very good, quick food service. Friendly neighborhood restaurant, would come back anytime.

ul8jSdhLJYRc9IHahGawRA.text: Unbelievable! We went there for lunch and the reuben was fantastic as well as the California chicken.  Wait staff was really great, we have been back twice within the past week and can foresee going there very regularly.  Breakfast omelette's are huge and the strawberry jam is something to write home about. great service, great food, you can tell cause it's always full of customers.

7DqmAMX4AWBu5zx0lSmdYw.text: Generous portions, but food is rather lackluster. I typically stick to what i usually order for breakfast foods, but decided to take a chance and Ordered breakfast tacos with chorizo and was underwhelmed. It was all i have tried, but with so many solid choices for breakfast joints, i won't return.

5sxEnK8OW5QDcLm1IdqOHQ.text: Service and food were great! The strawberry preserves are to die for! I was going to buy a jar on my way out but decided not to because I didn't want trust myself not to sit down and eat the entire jar!

DcVwxzb4oAv8vRZm9IbczQ.text: No complaints whatsoever.  Everything was great but I think my stomach yearns for smaller portions, cheaper prices and Grandma cooking in the back instead.

AsvLJm-pKv8r5UgvHp7eDQ.text: Had the fish and chips and iced tea. Subbed onion rings for fries. Two of us split it because the waitress said it was a pretty good size. The food was good, but not 20.00 good. Iced tea is 3.00, which is ridiculous, but we are finding is becoming the norm around here. It was okay but I wouldn't go back mainly because it's way too overpriced for what you get.

o38toI2S48oO8pQbK4PjRA.text: My mom and I stopped here for brunch, first time here. I ordered the 2 biscuit and gravy combo (eggs, ham and hashbrowns). Food was hot and service was decent, but very friendly. Everything was good except the hashbrowns and gravy. The hashbrowns were very overcooked and nearly burnt. The gravy was bland and lacked something. I believe it had rosemary in it, which didn't improve the taste. The orange juice was good but cost $5! I should have walked over to Starbucks.

0Z8dwckk3u1WWtnooWIt9Q.text: So today I tried their Alma location. The quality of the food I ordered was just as bad. I'll post the picture of what I have this morning .  FOOD WAS VEEY GREASY AND PANCAKE WAS JUST AS BAD.  Owner / manager of both location should check out the quality of the food that they serve. I think they fill your plate up with greasy patato to pacify their customers. Makes it look like they give you plenty of food. WE WANT QUALITY , not QUANTITY !

photos.caption: Photo of Biscuits Cafe - Chandler, AZ, United States. I had to pat the eggs with my napkin to get the excess grease off the eggs. NOT RECOMMENDING BISCUIT CAFE to anyone. Sorry
Photo of Biscuits Cafe - Chandler, AZ, United States. From Alma location
Photo of Biscuits Cafe - Chandler, AZ, United States. From Alma location

595uj4GtjB7te-8lV9wP2A.text: My daughter and I sat outside on the patio which was lovely. We both ordered the Avocado toast .  DELICIOUS!!!!  Our server was so sweet and attentive.   Would definitely go back.

VSozbiR7x6DBKxrNE4HLAQ.text: I've been here twice now for breakfast. The wait for a table usually isn't that long, however the wait for your food is.   We definitely got two different experiences both times we went. I Ordered the biscuits corned beef hash with an over easy egg. The corned beef was extremely dry and my egg was not over easy. It was more over medium I want to say. It took about 30 minutes to get our food and they originally gave us someone else's food.   On another note they have a very good country fried steak. That's probably the only thing that I've really enjoyed there and would order if I did come back.

-gnCzwbPFeQ26bQnxU6XLA.text: (Lyrics - Limp Bizkit - Break Stuff)  Its just one of those cafes  When you want to order coffee to wake up Everybody's ready for brunch  You don't really know why But you want to justify Eating a big breakfast!  Add ketchup with eggs You don't have time to interact Your mouths full of jelly smacks  Your best bet is to keep coming this way, Yelpers It's just one of those cafes!!  Biscuits Cafe is definitely one of those cafes; once you wake up to after a night out.  A night out with Jack, Jose, Sam Adams that is - wink!  Needless to say, Biscuits Cafe is a breakfast and brunch joint that serves up some wholesome breakfast mom used to make.  If you were born in the 50's and your mother actually cooked 3 main meals a day!  As that is now gone, Biscuits Cafe is probably one of the few closest place that brings that to life.  Welcome to the 21st century and I'm not talking about the insurance business!   I ordered their Chicken Fried Steak and guess what else it came with?  Bacon, hash browns, scrambled eggs, and pancakes!  Wowza!  I'm a quality guy and not so much a quantity so this was too much food.  I nibbled around and my Chicken Fried Steak wasn't too bad.  The gravy a top was nice and creamy and kept it warm.  The bacon was crispy and the hash browns were too.  The pancakes, well they were dry.  In the end, the entire meal was pretty dry aside from my gravy.   Overall, it was a nice experience and I rather enjoy long breakfasts with friends. The place itself is like an old school diner and service was good. - Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Biscuits Cafe - Chandler, AZ, United States
Photo of Biscuits Cafe - Chandler, AZ, United States
Photo of Biscuits Cafe - Chandler, AZ, United States

S7pKGdo3--XanpNfiIpRcw.text: Really nice patio area.  In addition to patio dining area it appears there's a place to sit while waiting to be seated.  Another plus. I was preceded by my son to the table so no clue how hospitable the host/hostess may have been.  Our waitress was timely and quite pleasant.  She used language that must work like subliminal messages because she seemed to convince me that I would enjoy my dining experience, even though it is not the same Biscuits I originally thought, and that I would be coming back here to dine again in the near future. After me taking a lengthy period of time to decide what I was hungry for we managed to place our order.  I will say that our waitress checked in at least three times before I had made up my mind.  Another plus.  I've sat and waited at other restaurants because I wasn't ready to order when the server first came to take an order. This girl was on task. My coffee mug was never empty and my son's beverage got to no less than 1/3 full during our meal. I ordered two eggs with rare bacon, red potatoes and a sweet potato pancake.  I asked if I could substitute the pancake and was told yes, but it would be one instead of two.  Heck, that's more than enough for me. Son had the chicken fried steak with the hash browns and biscuits.  He said the hash browns were not good at all, even after salt & pepper.  I suspect the were over boiled cuz how else could they be bad? My potatoes were good.  Creamy, nicely spiced and enhanced with a bit of onion.  My bacon was darn near perfect.  Thick, not excessively fatty and cooked to order.  Lots of places can't manage that last part.   And the sweet potato pancake was really good.  It was well flavored, dense and required no butter or syrup to enjoy.  A tad of butter and syrup seemed to transform my pancake into something more reminisce of sweet potato pie.  I shared it with my son and we got through about half of the thing.  He said the biscuit was light and fluffy in comparison.  A good contrast. Overall, nice atmosphere, wonderful service and tasty food.   We'll be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Biscuits Cafe - Chandler, AZ, United States. Drink the water, it taste good.

Photo of Biscuits Cafe - Chandler, AZ, United States. An easy GF option. Breakfast Tacos are scrambled eggs w/choice of meat on warm corn tortillas topped w/cheddar cheese &amp; served w/sc&amp;salsa.
Photo of Biscuits Cafe - Chandler, AZ, United States. Cinnamon Roll French Toast Combo comes with eggs and choice of meat.

mM3CjiSOOP7-mO47zGGSsw.text: We typically come once a week on Sunday for breakfast.  We always have great service, good food.  Today we had Angie as our server and we will never go back again. She came and took our drink order 10 min after being seated.  15 min later, still no coffee, so I went and found her and asked for coffee  She brought it, and said sorry we were out of cups...... (seriously?),  she took our breakfast order and dissappeared for the rest of the morning.  30 min later, a different server brought our food.  During this time, no one came to fill our cups so my husband went and found the pot and gave us both a refill.  After our food was delivered, Angie came by to make sure our food was right.  When I pointed out I asked for hash browns and got breakfast potatoes, she snarkily said, we I can bring you hash browns.... (seriously?)  Again, never came by to refill our cups or check on us again.  A different server came to clear our plates  When we decided to leave, we had to go find Angie again so we could get our check.  Not a great experience, never ever going back again.  It's a shame since the food is good and the other servers really hustle.

D77u5dDuAy9-xJoBIO6oWA.text: Went here for the first time with my mom yesterday for a Sunday brunch. We went there around 12:30 and it wasn't too crowded--we got seated immediately.  I had a hankering for corned beef and hash, so that's what I ordered. Unfortunately it wasn't quite what I was expecting...at other brunch places I've been to, the corned beef and hash browns are cooked and served together, but here the corned beef was served with scrambled eggs on top, and the hash browns were on the side. I was a bit disappointed by that.  Other than the disappointing food, everything else was great. Service was prompt, our food came out quickly, and our server stopped by our table multiple times to inquire about our meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Biscuits Cafe - Chandler, AZ, United States. Corned beef with hash browns

VD2LfrZ91WMG4_SQkjLDyw.text: After my morning Camelback hike, I knew just where breakfast was gonna be.  Rolling in around 7:30am, I knew I'd be beating the church crowd.  I've seen this place get packed, and its no joke, G!  My waiter, Darryl, was professional yet personable, allowing me time to look at the menu after offering a few suggestions.  The chicken fajita omelette was just the thing to satisfy the protein deficiency in me.  That bad boy was massive.  I dont think it was 4 eggs massive, but it was fairly sizable.  That entree came with hash browns and 2 large pancakes.  All were satisfying.  All in all, a good meal for when you're pondering the hand that life has dealt you... you know, when you feel like Ethan Hawke sitting at a card table in Training Day

kpXmAu47b24XmpxU13yfPw.text: This is a great place to grab brunch if you're not an early riser. The prices are a bit high, but hey, if you want breakfast during lunch hours then that's the price I guess. The place was cozy and spacious with friendly service.   This was my first visit to Arizona, and the French toast with berries instantly made my day. It was divine! The berries were fresh, and the French toast was soft and sweet. The syrup was just the right amount of sweetness as it is not stark raving sweet. The portion was fairly large so don't worry about them skimping out. My friend's plate was humungous. It seemed like the food was going to fall off his plate. Lol. He's a guy, and if he says it's a lot of food for him, then it's a lot of food.  I would totally recommend this place to anyone wanting a delicious brunch meal with a cozy place to sit and talk.

photos.caption: Photo of Biscuits Cafe - Chandler, AZ, United States

4vd4TPUOT5DKE7rMc_Oplg.text: I love this place!!! The pancakes are to die for and their sweetness level is perfect!!! Definitely recommend this place for a brunch with the ladies.

FuwY5akVkm9aczXSvQ8ctg.text: I positively love your food.  I used to order from you through DoorDash.  I stopped when you removed coffee from you Doordash menu.  I love the size and taste of your coffee.  I have reached out to DoorDash to suggest you put coffee back on your menu.  To date, my request has gone unanswered.  Please, please, please put coffee back on your DoorDash menu.

ccRg2qVHxzl36AzopLjS4w.text: Breakfast was delicious again. We came rather early so wasnt packed. I like the food here. I like the location in proximity to my house however I wish patio was a little more serene. They cant help that so I just choose to come early and sit inside. I like their pancakes but also their lunch items.
