659MmN7Hb2H7CogcSjqdcA.text: Went here on a day off mid week for a good brunchin'. I got the veggie omelette (minus the cream cheese) with the hash browns and side of fruit. Had to get coffee too , of course. The omelette was huge and very tasty. The hash browns were nice and crispy but a little too greasy for my liking. The coffee, however, was super yummy! Bonus.....the patio is dog friendly! Wish I knew that before I left my pup at home

z-wiJ-VPKLijlOTl_SMbhg.text: Let me tell you about the amazing breakfast I had last Sunday. Having mentally bookmarked Biscuits Cafe several times, we finally pulled the trigger to check it out. On the outside, the restaurant is unassuming, so I'll do the bragging for them.   Despite it looking busy, we were seated right away. Our waitress came by to wish us a good morning and pour us coffee and water. Their coffee mugs have a sleek black design with their red logo - also for purchase on the way out.   We pored through the menu calling attention to the great variety of breakfast specialties: Corned beef hash, black oak kielbasa, chicken apple sausage... I could go on. I ordered the Kielbasa, that came with two eggs, hash browns and a choice of biscuits, toast or pancakes. I chose the biscuits, which were soft and warm, tearing apart easily for me to lather on butter and what tasted like strawberry preserves. I don't often share amazing food, but I had to give my girlfriend a taste so she could see what I was raving about. Let me also point out that the hash browns are no ordinary helping. They overflow along the sides of your plate, offering a wonderfully tasty crunch and fresh potato underneath. And, the Kielbasa had just enough spicy, smoky tenderness to satisfy even the pickiest of sausage fans.  If my girlfriend hadn't ordered the Avocado Benedict, I would have. Fans of poached egg and hollandaise creations, look no further! These come with tomato and avocado, hash browns or red potatoes. Well assembled and not runny or soggy. Definitely in my top 3 of Benedict's ever tasted.  It was hard to leave food on my plate, but I had to. I was just too full to keep going. I can't wait until the next Sunday morning when I can come back for Round 2!

photos.caption: Photo of Biscuits Cafe - Chandler, AZ, United States. Kielbasa! Eggs, loads of hashbrowns and biscuits with very tasty preserves.

9CNJH4DnFa-gqvsS_Ez-6A.text: I tell ya, I've eaten here twice and will go back, but it's been interesting each time.  Most of the "interesting" vibe centers around the servers.    The first time, Mr. M and I both had regular bacon and egg breakfasts with an added order of B & G.  The place is named Biscuits for God's sake, so we must try the B.    The bacon is spectacular.  It was cooked perfectly and tasted and smelled how a BBQ smokehouse does.  Loved that.  Everything else was fine, except for the B & G.  It must have been an exception, because other reviewers have raved about it, but ours had 2 hard, dry biscuits.  No amount of gravy is going to soften those up in the 2 minutes it's at our table.  And speaking of the gravy, I could taste an overwhelming floury, pasty flavor and texture to the gravy.  My guess is someone was over-baked themselves that morning and made a thin batch of gravy and then went overboard with the flour or cornstarch or roux or whatever they use to thicken it.   I'm chalking that up as a fluke and will try those again.    Our server on the first visit was just straight up weird.  She acted like she didn't want to get too close to the table and would stand behind my left shoulder to talk to us, then would hustle away after we gave our orders.  Very strange.    The second time was a great visit overall, other than our server, Richard.  We were the only table seated outside at that time and it was a lovely sunny morning just before the heat ratcheted up.   When Richard greeted us he was very friendly and all smiles.  He took our order and that's the last we saw of him until it was check time.    They give you very teeny water glasses and those were empty in no time.  I also had a cafe mocha and that was very tasty and pretty as well.  I would definitely have that again.  The lack of water refills was annoying, but if I get annoyed enough I'll get up and go ask for more.     The avocado benedict was absolutely perfect.  The English muffin was toasted and then the eggs were cooked about medium.  Runny yolk, but not watery.  And the avocado was fresh, creamy deliciousness.   Fresh tomatoes as well that tasted like they were from the garden.  That meal was so good I'm going to have a hard time trying something else when I go back.    Mr. M got a regular bacon and egg breakfast but added a pancake so we could give that a try.  Everything he ordered was delicious as well.  We were eating kind of slowly for a change and just enjoying the morning and the weather when a busboy came on out and didn't say a word, but reached over us to attempt to grab the plate with a half-eaten pancake.   Oh no.  Oh no.  You do not want to risk losing a digit by doing that.  I was kind of shocked he didn't say a word, and I politely informed him we weren't finished yet.  I asked for more water, but never got it.  Ten minutes later here comes long-lost Richard, all smiles, presenting us with the check and thanking us profusely for coming in....laying it on pretty thick.  Richard, do you think I was born yesterday?  Your performance today earned you about a 12% tip, maybe less if I wasn't in such a good mood.  Servers should always come back and check about 2 minutes after the food has been dropped, and then about 10-15 minutes later and have their eyes open for drink refills.  At a minimum.  I learned it and lived it.  You can too.

wv2IiSJfPig2A47BfjFaJA.text: I love Biscuits Cafe. The food is always fresh and delicious! And the staff is always super friendly.

Ap13tKyn7bt65Oh3qm8vLg.text: Food was better on my most recent visit and place has gotten cleaner. I'll be returning again soon...................            .......

5sULqnvM3urdbZAPnSZ2DQ.text: Hey y'all!  I was so excited to see a new breakfast place settle into what I think is a very prime location - perfect for a huge residential neighborhood that doesn't want to travel north to Good Egg, east to Ihop or south for Mimi's.  I ordered the corned beef hash (one of my personal favorites that is not always on a breakfast menu, crazy - I know right?)  Husband wanted the Florentine Benedict without the spinach, but got talked into the Avocado, the kids chocolate chip pancakes.  I had a nibble ... well ... okay, I had like three nibbles and it was a very yummy pancake.  They were excited about their hot chocolates - the do a great job presenting it!  I liked my corned beef hash, but it was probably a little on the healthy side :) as it wasn't oozing with salt.  But that's actually a good thing because I'm trying to watch my portions and the salt would have begged me to devour the whole thing.  There was enough meat and potatoes for three breakfasts.  It was huge.  Poor husband.  He wanted the Florentine without the spinach because it's more like the Eggs Benedict he's accustomed to.  The server suggested the Avocado thinking that would be better but it didn't have HAM.  So he was a little deflated.  The hollandaise smelled very strong to me for some reason.  We ordered a side of bacon to compensate and while it was 4 slices of natural cut bacon, that was $4 worth of bacon.  Which leads me to the biggest beef ... it's probably a tad pricier than Good Egg and definitely pricier than Ihop.  So I had to nick a star, sorry guys.  Would I go back?  Definitely - I like the convenient location - maybe next time I'll try something a little 'easier' on the eyes.  And I like that it hasn't caught on just yet.  WHO WANTS TO WAIT FOR BREAKFAST?!  I am somewhat a patriot too, so I loved the wood paneled wall that had the Bill of Rights and Constitution framed ... made my heart feel good.  4 stars for good intentions ... and sorry for the long post ... it's a new place and I just wanted to make sure the people were informed.

-Ie0GIdjKziWdDiAAoLbvQ.text: This is a great new breakfast place.  I am being generous with the five stars because they are new and have still managed to do a great job. Usually, new places have lots of hiccups to work out but this place seems to be dialed-in.  The staff was great.  Our server, Susie, was very sweet and attentive.  I had the Joe's Scramble.  The bacon chunks they mixed in made this an awesome dish.  I will definitely order it again.  This may sound funny, but the wheat toast was really good.  It tasted fresh and the jelly appeared to be made by the restaurant because it was not the usual pre-packaged stuff.  The coffee had a delicious robust flavor.  For my seven-year-old, we ordered the eggs, pancake and sausage patty.  He gobbled it all up.  I tried his pancakes - very fluffy and delicious.  The hot chocolate he ordered came with whipped cream and chocolate sauce drizzled on top.  He was so excited by how fancy it looked.  Their menu was really diverse but not complicated.  I had trouble ordering because they had at least 4 different items I wanted to try.  Again, even though they're new, it looks like they hired really nice people and that always makes things work out in the end.  I will be coming back soon, especially since it's 3 blocks away from me.

gk_4wKBDkY53OeguHiWWOA.text: Wow, I love your breakfast. Your bread is absolutely fabulous and the homemade jelly is to die for!!! The chocolate strawberries are truly decadent! I think you should offer the strawberries at all of your locations! Awesome!!!!!

PZw3_0VfPEKZfolVpqKapQ.text: It has a lot of potential and good food but service wasn't up to par. First, they let two guests bring their pet birds on the patio and let them walk around ON the table while they were eating breakfast dropping bird poo all over the table. Yuck. Second, it took our server forever to bring out our food. And i was dry on water before a runner brought our food out and wasn't able to get a refill until we saw our server next when she brought the bill. The bill had extra items on it that we didn't order so we requested that the lady ringing us up take the extra items off and she simply said only our server could change the bill. Ok... Well you would expect her to help us find the server but instead made us wander around the restaurant ourselves looking for her. They fixed it, the bill, no problem but all in all, the staff should be a bit more attentive. They were kind and polite but just a bit lazy. It could have been worse but could have been better. Food was good though so it's a shame that my fiance and myself won't be coming back for more :(

IvEguEoKb0-bwkeXUmwYsQ.text: I was very excited for this Cafe to open as I live in the neighborhood. My 3 star rating is for the following reasons. Never go to a new restaurant the first month it is opened, my mistake the staff is still dealing with hiccups. The first time I went  I ordered the reuben sandwich, my waitress said it would be great. You can get a better reuben at Arby's for less money not to mention they forgot to put the sauce on it. The second time I ordered the corned beef hash. When it came to the table I was impressed until I saw my poached eggs. One was okay the other was missing the white completely. The waitress was happy to correct the egg mishap but instead of just ordering another poached egg she took my entire plate leaving me with nothing as the rest of my family happily ate. When it did finally come it the yolk was almost cooked. I ate it because by then I was hungry, irritated and my family was done.  The corned beef was difinitely the star and was very good, the bacon is also chunky and good. What really surprised me is that even though the manager came over and talked to me about my egg mistake I still had to pay for it which is very POOR business for a place that just opened. I still have hope and will try one more time, if they can't get it right on the third try their out of there!!!

r5WG6No_eTfOfOMMdcceWA.text: When it 1st opened it was like a secret place but it seems to be getting busier. We love it here--good and consistent. If we bring the pups and sit outside, they are very accommodating to us. Wish the outdoor was bigger and more shaded, enjoy sitting out. Everything I've ordered has been good. Great price and portions. Close to home. Biscuits and strawberry jam is sooo good. Yes the biscuits are small but, who cares, they are good. One day we had an extra long food wait so our waitress brought us out biscuits and jam to snack on--great service!

Et0JXOD_fTsmXm1MQS18zw.text: This is a hidden gem. Great breakfast and lunch choices. Big portions for reasonable price. I like their chicken avocado sandwich! Friendly hostesses too. Try it!

ve0dnDHmOqBnN_P7pAJtDQ.text: My daughter and I stopped in for breakfast about 930 today and  were greeted warmly, served promptly and had the best meal since moving here in 1973!  We could not believe our eyes when the server placed our order in front of us.  The food looked too good to eat.  The food tasted even better.  The portions were way beyond what  we could possibly eat.  My favorite meal is breakfast and I have prepared many and have eaten way too many bad ones out.  This was the best ever.  N/w corner of Warner and Dobson .    A little information-  I gave this place a try because I had the opportunity to see the kitchen a few weeks prior.  Spotless!  The cleanest restaurant kitchen I have ever been in.     Worth every penny.

pw89j5NKiBQOr8OqOZtd8w.text: The service was 5-star excellent by a very experienced server.  The food was also excellent.  I ordered an egg white veg. omelet.  It came with very generous sides of potatoes and something else, which I substituted for raw tomatoes since it was way too much food for one person to eat at one sitting.  My companion had a pancake/scrambled egg combo which was again...way too much food if one has a normal appetite.  For a big eater, this is a great place!  The manager was most definitely visible and "hands-on" in the visible kitchen.  If you are into a "breakfast/lunch/close at 2:30pm" kind of place, Biscuits Cafe should be on your to-do list.  Pretty, clean, and pretty good food.

U39R5T0NXX7klTHsKwh-ZA.text: omg~!   solid is an understatement~!   the red potatoes are as good as my brother @tony aguilar makes them~!  couldn't have meat because of lent and they had soooooo many things to choose from~!  we had the spinach benedict. ....the best hollandaise sauce ever~!   then we splurged on a home made cinnamon roll~!   it was double huge and soooooo yummy~!   service was as phenomenal as the food~! i never wanted for anything~!    ;)

6iZL27aKJA8XJ0Zp3hGr8g.text: This place is the absolute worst. The waitress was eating and cleaning the refrigerator after she took our drink order and took 10 minutes to get us two iced teas. She touched the rims of the glasses with her hands, which were covered with cleaning solution. After 30 minutes our food was still not served and four other parties were served before us. We saw one of our items sitting on the counter getting cold for 15 minutes while the other servers were bending over the counter and squishing the food with their aprons.  When we complained about how long it was taking the manager started arguing with us, so we left the payment on the table in cash and walked out. The attitudes of the staff and manager are EXTREMELY poor. Not only does this place NOT care about the quality of service it also seems that the employees ignore health codes and do not care about remaining in business. STAY AWAY AND DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY!

SM4ts-rg4AKBkU-UvIFi4g.text: I've driven by here a lot on my way to work and thought my boyfriend and I would have to try it one day.  Today happened to be that day and we had a bogo coupon that came in the mail. It was 10am and the place was empty except for 3-4 tables, plus the table in the very back by the bathroom that had a group of older people, (I personally would not sit back there as I would feel like an ignored customer.) We were seated quite quickly at an awkward booth and chair table. Looked at the giant menu that was overpriced while waiting for drinks to find what looked tasty and ordered. My boyfriend ordered a simple waffle and I ordered the southwest delight scramble with biscuits and red potatoes,  it sounded good. The description was three scrambled eggs, with peppers, onions, tomatoes,  spicy chorizo sausage (mind you it says spicy), salsa, sour cream, and corn tortillas.  After about 10-15 minutes our food arrived. His waffle was mediocre and kind of dry he stated. Mine, it was thrown on the plate and was not pleasant to look at. As I stated earlier about the spicy chorizo, there was no spice to be had. The eggs were soggy and were loaded with stringy onions and mushy tomatoes with no peppers to be seen. It was very bland. The potatoes were burt to a crisp. You think of a biscuit being hot, light, and fluffy, these were heavy, tasteless, balls of dough. As I was studying my plate I came to notice my salsa, sour cream and corn tortillas were missing from the dish. I did not bother to ask because it would not have made the meal better. I was done after two bites. I just finished my biscuit and ate what non burnt potatoes I could find. Our waitress came by to see how things were going and I bluntly put it out there that my dish was bland and not good. She seemed oblivious, stated "oh!" and walked away. We thought she was getting a manager, but turns out just went back to serving her other tables with nothing else to be said only to come back and drop the check. We will not be back. Bad food and bad service. I wouldn't even give this one star but you have to rate it something.

fvVtChZhPYaaiWv-5Fj8uw.text: The Service and Food are great!!  Natalie and Richard took very goog care of me.  It's not often I remember the servers names but this place feels like home.  The food was hot and tasty.  A real family hot spot, the kids had a blast.  We needed a new breakfast place in Chandler and Biscuits fills the void.  The Jams and Jellies are out of this world.  Will be back many times over.

aaYs_K4sjoncBGGrhI3tuA.text: Excellent service, wonderful food,  we love the homemade jam.  After 15 years in the area this is our favorite breakfast .

SXoadtqJi-9SjYCjn5hu5Q.text: Awesome food! Yes it is a little more than Denny's but the portions you get are more than excessive. Be prepared and come with an empty stomach. After the massive and delicious cinnamon roll (homemade frosting was heavenly) I had their Biscuits omelette with a side of a sweet potato pancake. Everything was amazing, I couldn't put down my fork. Will definitely be going back and make it a regular spot!

Y32OepeCqhlfkz6kQAogwA.text: Very impressed with this cafe.  I had biscuits and gravy with eggs and bacon.  My friend had Eggs Benedict and it looked great and she said it was wonderful.  I will sure be going back know my husband would love this place.

ufHHS4f_uQu0he4HVlvhng.text: Nice ambiance, homemade biscuits. Overall breakfast average at best. Wait time is long for what you get.

Kml9Q7NKTGScJKXRDvlw_w.text: Alright, I was pretty impressed with this place the first time 5 months ago.  Since then I have gone back because of that and even bringing others here.   Now I have changed my review because they have continually disappointed me.  They never seem to get my eggs cooked the way I like them.  The corn beef hash use to be fresh and plentiful and now they are skimpy and dry.  The bacon (use to give 4 and now only 3?) my husband ordered was greasy and not crispy.  He likes his toast to be well toasted and they brought them out completely burnt.  It was sent back and all they did was scrape some of the burnt off the toast.  Our eggs were either underdone or overcooked.   They didn't even look appetizing.  The last time we were there the manager saw what was happening but didn't even come to our table to apologize.   So disappointing each time and we kept giving them another chance.  Their quantity and quality has gone down.  Most plates being fairly pricey at 10 bucks a plate for breakfast,  we think now its not worth it. Their motto "fresh and fast",  I think NOT.

TsNcr8a1DyVpBiL2QYyTCw.text: The food is excellent, the servers wonderful. It gets very crowded on weekends, but the staff stays on top of things well. We always enjoy the food, and especially recommend the BLT, they serve very tasty bacon...Best new breakfast and lunch restaurant in our local area. A nice touch is their frequent diners' club: earn discounts on further meals by signing up (no card required, they take your phone number at the cash register). Very nice surprise to have an occasional ten dollars removed from the bill..just remember to tip the waiter on the whole amount...grins...

eIugqhu9xC1B5cl_aC4Cvg.text: I definitely recommend the breakfast, the food was great. However,  it is a long wait 30 min before food came out. In addition,  the manager maybe owner was very gruff and made us uncomfortable.

NGjlFsn9DhkW8TncYg19DQ.text: Awesome Florentine eggs benedict!!! Service was adequate but not overly attentive... it was way too freaking hot to even contemplate the patio today but in cooler months this would be an awesome place to enjoy!!! I know it's weird but I wasn't looking for a mimosas or a Bloody Mary so I'm not sure they have that but that would make it even better!!! Yay!  You can pick up HUGE cinnamon rolls on the way out to take home and enjoy. They look amazing!

LHUB4yVgp5cci2VDNZgaHw.text: We came after the lunch crowd and this being my first time here I had to ask the others what is good to eat. I decided to order the Almond Crusted French Toast. It was good, came with two eggs, and you are given a choice of ham, bacon or sausage. I elected to go with the sausage. It was somewhat good and it was more than enough. I will give this a three star only because it is more of a breakfast place than a lunch place. I would say it would be a great breakfast place in the morning. Service was great as an added bonus.

oMiP90fCBE5kQoPLYlu65w.text: Breakfast was ok.  I ordered the biscuits gravy with eggs and sausage.  I guess I was expecting the biscuits to be special considering that's their name, but they looked to be from a can.  The gravy was pretty bland as well.  I would probably go back but try something else.

bk75jfFmdKSrdbj9a-vtNQ.text: Fist time here came to meet my friend for breakfast. As usual I was here first and started with coffee. It was hot and really good.  After my friend came our waitress was really wonderful and didn't push us to order right away. A girls got to catch up doesn't she?  The food was outstanding. Large portions, I couldn't finish my French toast.  Please forgive me I forgot out waitress name, but she kept the coffee coming never had to be asked.  Will I go back.  I did already and this time took my husband and daughter.

yCHfohZw2lR4WK5SpXYYIA.text: I was very disappointed with this restaurant.  We waited 40 minutes for our breakfast and it wasn't busy at the time.  Then the food was so-so. Eggs were overlooked.

IjbUBJhFkQL2Nx0qbAjhXw.text: Great breakfast place, but they need a hostess to sit people. I don't mind waiting for a table if it is crowded. But there were empty tables and and it was taking a long time to get seated. There was about 3 different groups the just left because it was taking to long. 5/10/18

BxUobI3u2VJmx9YMeIi_4g.text: I don't always make it to brunch because I like to stay up late and sleep-in even later but when I do, it's usually because I'm craving eggs benedict.    I'm talking beautifully poached eggs, waiting to ooze out runny yolks at the gentle prick of a fork or knife, slathered generously with velvety smooth hollandaise sauce with just the right amount of citrus... yaaaaas!  That's what J-WoW likes!  Yes, it's bad for you.  We're talking about condensing all your daily recommended allotment for protein, fat [50+ grams], cholesterol [500+ mg], calories [1,000+], and salt into ONE SERVING.  Throw on a side of hash browns and a giant cinnamon roll to nibble on while waiting for your dish and its like, wow, what even?  But like I said, I'm not up for brunch usually and I certainly don't eat breakfast during my work days so why not?  It's Saturday.  Can I live?  So I came to Biscuits Cafe for my eggy indulgence.  While I positively drooled over their warm gooey cinnamon roll that was probably the size of my face, I was already fantasizing about sliding my knife across a gorgeous poached egg.  I wanted my knife to mar that perfection hidden behind hollandaise and spew its yolky guts all over my plate as I lick my knife clean and marvel at the gruesome display.  I swear we're talking about assassinating eggs, people.  What I got though were soft medium-boiled eggs and hollandaise sauce with no hint of lemon juice.  My heart was sad but it was still demolished.  Although I did trade half of one of my avocado eggs benedict for a few bites of Southern Delight scramble.  Dang.  That was some greasy egg, yo.  While I do think the quality and ingredients are decent at Biscuits, I don't think I'll be popping in to fulfill my eggs benedict craving.  Dat cinnamon bun doe.  Mmm!

13FU4nBTCa7HX5FQVmltBw.text: This place is very good. The corned beef hash is amazing. They have the best homemade strawberry jam. Service was amazing and served promptly. I will be coming here again.

_SX30qFt0qSFkCHwqpIK8Q.text: I'm writing this review mainly to remind myself the next time I want nearby breakfast, not to go here.  The service is fine.  You get s big coffee mug to drink out of which is nice, but a small water cup. Its the food that disappoints me. I ordered an omelet but as I had forgotten- the way they do omelets here is not the way I do omelets.  The eggs are scrambled and then the meat and veggies are are placed inside and then a slice of cheese is simply placed on top of the folded over eggs.  The way I do omelets is to scramble eggs and then place the meat and veggies and cheese inside and fold it over.  Boyfriend ordered scrambled eggs with 2 links of sausage and 2 strips of bacon.  The bill totaled to $31.00 which for what we got- was not worth it.

QdtOdo-Ic-VZ4fFR2cB41A.text: The pancakes are excellent. I have never had better. Chicken fried chicken was average but the gravy was better. The hash browns would have been awesome if they were hot. My eggs over easy we're undercooked. Outside patio is very nice. The inside not so nice. I would go back for the pancakes.

photos.caption: Photo of Biscuits Cafe - Chandler, AZ, United States. Nice patio area.

uU_uPgwy8cRh82k4clFFfQ.text: I'm reviewing the NEW location at 101 and Thunderbird. I'm not trying to hurt their business, I'm trying to get the owners to improve. I ordered breakfast thinking that any restaurant that had Biscuit in the name and is displayed on their building must have GREAT biscuits. It's fair to note that I am a southern boy and know my biscuits and gravy.  Their biscuits are small and bland. Yes there is a hint of buttermilk but they are over-kneaded and a little over cooked. Over-kneaded biscuit dough becomes bread dough taking away the flaky texture that we want in a good biscuit. Next the gravy. It was doughy and filled with herbs. Herbs in cream gravy? Really? I know they were trying to simulate the sausage flavor with out adding sausage but hey for $12.50!!! I got two dinky eggs smothered in grill shortening (ugh!), three strips of bacon (ok) and two small biscuits with really sub standard gravy.  Put sausage in your gravy! If you do need a better recipe, use real cream, real breakfast sausage that's cooked and drained, and just slightly brown your flour roux to give it a nutty bread flavor and not a doughy imitation flavor. And really guys make fresh homemade buttermilk biscuits and make them big ( like your Cinnamon on rolls). You may not make your margins but you will bring in and establish regulars. Otherwise Change your name, at this point you're being deceptive.

V2DvjLjQmELQWFNwe4ow9Q.text: Food is delicious. Service was great. My four year old said it best, "Mommy we come here for every breakfast k mommy?"

siOiBzIzPraSxGBeH8YQWg.text: We stopped for lunch here with our dog and enjoyed it thoroughly. We had chicken tenders, burger, and turkey sandwiches. Everything was hot and tasty. I wish they had a location nearer to us.

Y1Ur87ooe8NTE_bsXBbRvA.text: Pass on this. If I am going to load on carbs they better not make me regret it. My dish was not good. My husband did not enjoy his. Ok another place we would rather not spend money on

sbrTfJ6vd4iKUjivW0omLw.text: Ok I have been back to this restaurant several times since my initial review and I have to say this is my new fav breakfast place !! I have tried the French toast with eggs and bacon , the cinnamon roll French toast with eggs and bacon , and most recently the smoked brisket eggs Benedict.. That my friends is a knockout !! The hollandaise definitely wasn't from a mix or a can .. Run my friends and don't miss out on this treasure Seriously best breakfast ever !!!!

vV929XPdkvOZJOgnzq7ePA.text: Biscuits gets  2 stars but $$$ for price. Your meal come complete with sticky table, long wait time (we went  for breakfast)  then an  additional wait time for forgotten food ordered like eggs and toast together. Coffee is bitter lacks flavor and aroma. Substitutions  like berrys instead of hashbrowns is a $2 up charge. Breakfast for 2 cost  was $30.00. Ouch!

WtSi1AD_PCmMkU-cp8jjEQ.text: Grabbed breakfast here with a friend. I got the turkey & veggie scrambler. The food and service were good and the inside if the restaurant was nice. I probably would have given 4 stars, the reason I'm only giving 3 is because I was blown away by how expensive it was when I got my bill. I did substitute berries for potatoes as my side but still it was $22 (over $25 with the tip) for a plate of eggs and a cup of coffee. I mean this is just a diner, typical denny's/ihop type food - nothing special. Good but not that good.

photos.caption: Photo of Biscuits Cafe - Chandler, AZ, United States

2tX-yarvEg2D9NThKXsqrg.text: The food is beyond awesome and the cafe is unique  and quaint. We enjoyed everything and especially the friendly fast service

Zk7pm1HOtJoCmO1TW4MeEg.text: My favorite is the Country Benedict.  They always poach the eggs just right, not too hard or over cooked.  The hash browns have some kind of weird taste like the oil is bad or something but I put the sausage gravy on it and then it's great.  The sausage gravy is the best I have ever had.  It has some kind of herb that just add that little something that other places don't have.   Service is always terrific.  The wait staff are so friendly and polite.  I don't know their names but in particular there is a young African American man and a petite lady with short brown hair who always make you feels so welcome.  I know it can be a demanding job, but these two always seem like there is nothing they would rather do than help you.  Really nice customer service.   The cinnamon rolls are amazing, similar to Cinnabon but better.   I once had a patti melt but wasn't impressed.  The bread wasn't crunchy and the burger was greasy.  I'll stick to the breakfast as they have never let me down with that!!!!  This is a great place to dine.

kEkl58hf61asAf6vDi8KkQ.text: I like the feel of this cafe style spot. I ate breakfast, but there were other options for lunch as well. The food is better than Denny's and the staff is friendly. I would definitely eat here again when i'm in the area for breakfast! I had a chicken fried steak - we all know it's all about the gravy, and I'm glad to say that I enjoyed theirs . . . the most important part of the review is the taste!

pZLTlu_8CoDg4baTMZMjmA.text: I love a good breakfast place and this was my go to place.  Today I went and received the worse service ever.  They let me wait and wait to put my order in.  The waitress acted like she did not want to wait on me.  They actually acted like my family was invisable.  They looked me straight in my eyes several times and looked over me several times.  I thought I was in the Twilight Zone.  The cherry on top was when a waitress asked me and my family to move from our table as though we were a problem.  I politely got up and left and nobody attempted to stop me.  Let me add that the bathroom was filthy.  I got the distinct feeling that the staff did not want to wait on us because we were Black.  This has never happened to me at this particular place, but I have been around long enough to know when I am not wanted in an establishment.  I will never go to this restaurant again and I will no longer recommend it to friends and family.

C8pWcblaiwdtMh8aFN1Y0w.text: A real disappointment. Thought with the name biscuits in the name, the biscuits would be good. I was wrong, they were obviously not fresh or made on site. I recommend not ordering the biscuits.

WvpHcbfsgN2-vcYby6-8aQ.text: My new favorite breakfast place!! Large portions at a reasonable price! Phenomenal biscuits and gravy!! Make sure to try the homemade strawberry jam!

LQs1sX1fXQjht36weCPA4g.text: Had a wonderful breakfast here.  I really enjoyed their way of doing potatoes and of course the biscuits are light and tasty!

8-h-HyNW359jCgFb36AcCQ.text: I showed up at Biscuits Cafe with my wife and toddler five minutes before they closed on a Sunday. They were gracious in allowing me to sit and eat. They served me quickly and attentively and the food was awesome. The Ruben was amazing. Definitely a new favorite.

3hhrqV81lzfKDKi2GF5lBQ.text: Wow, Biscuits I love you! Thank you for opening up in my neighborhood. I love to support non-corporate food establishments and to see "mom & pop's" do well. It's the American dream, right?  I have been here at least 10 times. Everything I've had tastes homemade. This is no greasy spoon kind of joint.   There was once a corned beef eggs Benedict as a special and it was spectacular! I have asked for it since and they will happily make it for me. It is definitely homemade with large meaty chunks of corned beef. To die for!  The French toast is also very, very good and usually what I order. The difficult choice is which one to order. I think there is four options. I have had the almond crusted once and cinnamon roll version a few times. The almond crusted was really delicious, but I keep going back to the cinnamon roll version.  Imagine cinnamon rolls sliced, dipped in egg batter and cooked to perfection. I order the grilled ham with it. They cook it so it is browned on the edges, but still moist and not dried out. Just the way I like it.   I have taken friends and family to my new favorite breakfast place and all have really enjoyed the food and great service. They are a very friendly staff.   I stopped in for lunch once and had the turkey sandwich with cranberry sauce. It wasn't bad, I was just underwhelmed. Their breakfasts just set the bar to a higher standard. I have heard that the burgers are great.  Maybe next time I'll try one.

Tqnu47k6VU-NlVA09MCNqg.text: This place is like a half mile from our house and we finally got around to trying it.  Impressive menu and the place is bigger than it looks from the road. Chicken fried steak and eggs were great and the service was friendly and very attentive. Definitely will be returning.

4NKbYFxaiUuuKcFnqUFcqg.text: Meh, not so good. The place was clean and the service was good but the food not so much. I had the corned beef hash. It was fresh but it had huge pieces of corned beef and not hashy enough for me. The potatoes in the hash were crunchy not cooked enough. My husband had a Belgian waffle and sausage links. The links were cooked through but the texture was soft and mushy it felt like eating raw pork. My aunt had 1/2 sandwich and chicken noodle soup she said it wasn't anything special. Plus neither my aunt or husband like strong coffee and that is all they offer. You can't please everyone but that's why there is Yelp.

I-FwfsoCibjBR-WV0_TnEw.text: This place is close to my place and it's convenient  when I'm craving for brunch over the weekends to come here and get eggs. Service is always super slow, but good is pretty good. My girlfriend asked for coke and literally took for ever to bring her drink.

VjFuPv3YGoRu2L4CDOOi6A.text: What can I say about this place FIRST?!?!?!  It was insane and we got there at 10:45...I am assuming the crowd that wakes up late because we did!!!  We were politely greeted and seated immediately.  If your server is Darryl I can assure you that your drink will never be empty and he even brought us a drink to GO!  To say that guy ROCKS is an understatement.  He was on the move and we never went without anything.  For the first time there it was a definite thumbs up and Darryl made the entire experience for me.  He almost read our minds!!  Thanks Darryl!

9XfWd2q247QSDKREUqYjcA.text: A good breakfast close to home and they stay open a little later than many breakfast spots.  Good service too?

6oMTK5lyUHp4a_WcFwZXjQ.text: Becarful of the email rewards they send you  discounts with no expiration date but they do have a time frame that you find out at the cash register.when it's to late. Confronted the manager and after waiting 10 minutes he pulled up the email rewards for justification of the discount denial.He had no empathy for our concerns!  Lost a long time customer of a few dollars.

BMLWckqjyh1YwcP_j_I2bw.text: A nice breakfast joint breaking away from the usual chains I frequent, whether actually for breakfast or after leaving a bar, this place was refreshing. I got the biscuits and gravy and was actually pleased with my choice thinking it was going to be like any other B&G I've had a hundred times before. If I ever finally become a bonafide morning person I'll probably pop by a few more times to try a few other dishes.

Zuv7TjQpoTWt2Q4bn2RL4g.text: I have been to this restaurant approximately 20 times. Most of which when they first opened. Under the original management they were awesome. Coffee filled, food great, and timely. When management changed Biscuits tanked. The food and service suffered. A few days ago my wife said she had a coupon. I reluctantly decided to go again and see if things changed. Horrible is the best word I can give my experience!!! 3 meals- BLT with avocado, corned beef, biscuits and gravy w/ eggs and bacon. No avocado on sandwich, corned beef sopping wet soggy, biscuits plate was cold. Several coffee runners passed my table without asking if I wanted a refill. I returned my sandwich and had Monica our waitress remove my meal from the bill. Monica said she could get avocado for my sandwich. I declined. From that moment Monica's attitude became distant towards us. I told the cashier and I believe shift leader about our experience. They seemed shocked and reluctantly apologized. I have in the past voiced my distaste with the decline in service to no avail. Needless to say but I will, I will not be spending my money at Biscuits no matter how many coupons they send!!!

pCnIdcTGO6mMofcMIH_0Cw.text: I went here once for lunch with some co-workers. Portion sizes are great. The server was attentive. I ordered a veggie omelet and was not overly impressed. It's was okay, not great but not horrible.

jWGmcGrKgz09EZn8H5KAbA.text: Had a late breakfast here today.   Was very disappointed in the quality of the food.  The red potatoes were burned and tasteless.  They were served with a veggie wrap in a flour tortilla that was gummy and mushy.  Hubby had sausage with eggs and biscuits and gravy.  They were served with hash whites instead of hash browns.   He did eat most of his except for the hash.  Coffee is very weak.  Basically we will not be returning.   The redeeming factor of the visit was the waitress and the young man who seated us.  They were both very nice and attentive.

r9Imb3ZNZV9zt5Qgwibxrg.text: My husband and I met a friend here for Sunday brunch.  There was a decent crowd, but we didn't have to wait long for a table.  The service was fast and efficient.  I enjoyed the coffee, but after perusing their menu, I kind of wish I had tried the cafe mocha since the coffee was nothing too special.  I ordered off of the "Keeping it Simple" section, where you basically get to choose three of the numerous options listed.  I did enjoy the sweet potato pancake, but as for everything else, it was pretty standard breakfast stuff.  My husband ordered the biscuits and gravy, which is their specialty.  He wasn't too impressed with it, perhaps because it was lacking in flavor.  Overall, we'd probably go back, but as far as brunch places go, this one was decent, but not very memorable.

7s-njtZihwu9DPDxffZEJg.text: Very cool place !! Has misters out side  had a good breakfast   That's my review thank you for reading!!!!:)

tkD9-zFZB9T-jGAlijmhHQ.text: I tried this place for the first time on Saturday and was very happy that I did. This is going to be one of my favorite breakfast places! The staff was top notch with fast friendly service. I had the ham and eggs with a pancake and hash browns. Everything was very flavorful and cooked perfectly.  My friend had the made from scratch corned beef hash and it looked awesome so I will want to try that myself next time. They had a sign on the door "We don't serve fast food, we serve good food as fast as we can"  The strawberry preserves were really good, I was tempted to buy a jar of them on my way out. Price was reasonable for the quality and quantity of food I received. I will definitely be a regular here!

GEC4-eMT50ry79gMxBgUYg.text: I decided to take my boyfriend out for a nice Sunday breakfast at a nice little cafe around the corner from his house. We arrived a little after 11AM and had to wait about 15 minutes. Once we were seated, we noticed how cute the decor inside was and how many great choices the menu offers. I decided to get an omellete, red potatoes and biscuits and gravy. We waited about 15 minutes for food but everything that came out was good. Service was spotty but not complaining. I would come back to try some of the other menu items.

axMek7JCNpvhuSKz1Yge8g.text: This has to the worst breakfast place ever!!! The food was gross!! Although our service was good. First off the coffee was ok and there was no fresh cream only package cream, second we asked our server about the chicken fried steak. He said it was the best thing on menu. But it comes frozen!?!? After our food came we asked a few more questions because it didn't taste right. Everything they have and serve is FROZEN!!!!! Even the eggs are not real eggs! They come in a huge bag!!! My eggs Benedict I took back because the eggs and hollandaise was all watery!!! I don't get it. This place was packed?!?! We will never eat here again!!!! Waste of money!!! It only gets one star for our server!

62Mav95cs_0mrtpTM7wwXQ.text: The service was good, and the breakfast was good. However, I would not go back because when we were seated we were presented with dirty torn menu's.  No excuse for that lack of pride,  and it instantly made me feel the place was dirty.

zeM9Vl3NlL1T39HUUfv35A.text: This place has a solid breakfast menu that includes generous portions and tasty dishes. Accordingly, it has become one of my regular spots to get a sleep-in, roll-out-of-bed weekend late breakfast. Not all of the dishes are my favorites, however. I tried the almond-crusted French toast and found it a bit heavy and bland. The almond crust seems to Noneify the eggy goodness that usually defines French toast. I recommend the Cinnamon Apple French toast instead. The cooked apples and cream cheese are so luxurious that you forget to drizzle maple syrup on top!  As for the biscuits and gravy, I do find this to be a palatable dish but woefully underseasoned. They have nailed the creaminess of the gravy, but I feel they could step up the sausage and seasoning to make this dish really shine. The bacon here is thick and cooked to perfection, and I have never had any serious issues with the service, although I think sometimes the wait staff needs a tiny amount of prodding to stay on task.  In summary, I'm delighted to have this restaurant in my neighborhood and plan on coming here repeatedly in the forseeable future.

lTice5soLImKsh_-gC3clg.text: It's Sunday morning, I'm hungry and it's about 10:30 a.m. I've been waiting for this place to open for weeks, and it finally is.  The servers were super attentive and friendly. I had the Florentine Eggs Benedict, which was in one word, AMAZING. My friend had the Veggie Head Omelet which she loved. The portions are generous and they are good about refilling beverages. If you like hash browns, this is the place to come, they are cooked perfectly and not one bit greasy. The homemade jam was delish. The menu has some great options for breakfast and lunch. Thanks for opening in my neighborhood. I'll be back for sure!

IIhEr77nxOC3yfiCM7pcIw.text: No matter how packed this place is the service is always amazing! The wait times are never long and the staff is always busy making sure every table is taken care of!  Highly recommend. Even on the weekends,

lKY8af1MLoiEyWPKY49xug.text: Food was cold. Biscuits were dry and gravy was salty and weirdly seasoned. Will never try again. Left feeling like it was waste of money and ruined our Sunday brunch tradition.

SearF6RjMy14h0DcJK0jfg.text: I've been driving by Biscuits since it opened. It's within walking distance of home. On a regular basis, I looked at it and thought "I should try that some time."  Hey, it only took a year! After chauffeuring my mom around town this morning, we stopped in to grab lunch. The menu offers a wide variety of breakfast and lunch entrees, and yes, breakfast is served all day.  I opted for the California club. It was enormous. It came smothered in cheese, with perfectly crisp, thick-cut bacon, and the most amazing avocado slices I have ever seen. The turkey was adequate. Nice ciabatta bread, just the right amount of squishy. My potato salad, on the other hand, was more like cold mashed potatoes. If you like smooth potato salad, you'll probably like this. If not, pick another side.  Mom went for the cranberry turkey sandwich. It was notable not only for the fact that it came with cream cheese (weeeird), but that the cream cheese was--I crap you not--a good quarter-inch-thick layer between the bread and the turkey. She reported it to be good, which was probably True since all conversation stopped once she dug in.  Our waitress was on top of things and kept the iced tea flowing. I'd go back. And I probably will, to check out the breakfast offerings.

2gVeVgYABrRQRSLqWtGxqw.text: I've already come to Biscuits about 20 times since they've opened, and I can say that they excel in everything I would hope for in a breakfast place: the food is great, the service strong, the atmosphere clean and inviting, and the wait not overwhelming.  All of the french toast options are amazing (especially the Almond crusted kind) and the omelettes are solid (although the chorizo is on the mild side if you're opting for that.)  I love this place and hope it has a long and successful future.

IojwgEkfPGrwk2CE1uXuyA.text: Bacon bacon bacon!!!!! Awesome!!!   Some of the best think crunchy bacon I have had.   Been here several times and each time I am greeted with a smile and great service. The food is always fast and has great flavor. You can really tell that the owners care about service and their customers.   Keep it up I will be coming back for more.  Thank you.

RkszqpWatYIAivzmZX8IAg.text: This place is amazing!  Love love love the biscuits and crazy.

nPs-GdA9a8z5fFsnx-kteA.text: I was happy when I finally ate here since it is located just a block down the street from my house.  The atmosphere is very home-style kitchen esque. I absolutely love their eggs benedict and who can resist a giant gooey cinnamon roll!! The coffee could be stronger for sure, but unless I'm at a coffee shop or home, my expectation of receiving strong coffee anywhere is pretty low.

IG0OM8G-bMAxd-WS5AmOjQ.text: we went for breakfast while visiting the area. Good food, reasonable prices, plenty of seating, great wait staff, very friendly.

gQsbKudpqbLhW8ZyUxvIVA.text: Went for breakfast this week. It is your run of the mill breakfast food. Nothing spectacular as we dive into foodie craziness these days but fills your belly. Great coffee. Added bonus is they use Pacific NW preserves! Service great, food, ok.

ebTRSdzUqdlTfXWdm_MFsg.text: Let just say I wouldn't go here if you want a light breakfast, very heavy food, kinda made me sick

3eiYBKDiklXKNC2gl0SsLQ.text: Absolutely loved this place! We looked up places to eat and this came up and we are very glad we went! My boyfriend got the Ham Scramble which was awesome and I got the Cinnamon French Toast combo and it was great! The service was great, the restaurant was also kept very clean, and everyone seemed to have a smile on their face and looked like they enjoyed working there! I would defiantly try it, we'll be back!

NGKOkdAWGGSvbNg-DOjIuw.text: This was our first visit to Biscuits.  My husband ordered a Western Burger that was humongous! He could only eat half and had the remaining half for dinner. I ordered the California Club which was fantastic. I also could only eat half & saved the rest for later.  Service was great, servers were polite and made sure our coffee mugs were full.  We will be returning as this will be one of our go to's for late breakfast/ lunch outings!

O1jyT7ZApFB36xkI53OKkQ.text: I'm a French toast fanatic. I've tried a lot French toast platters at different restaurants. This place wins tho. Best French toast I have ever had. Almond crusted for the win. If you go, by all means - get it. It's excellent. Service was good, and it has a friendly vibe. I will be going back for sure.

7aqE4sebBjspH5x3RZ8pPQ.text: Love this place. I have tried their chicken fried steak, waffles, and biscuit specials. They were all great! Fast service. The staff make sure your drinks are always refilled. Our favorite morning place!!

nH-fUkfdC3snlCWXDLs7cg.text: We ate here for the first time yesterday...while the service was great, the food was mediocre. He ordered the specialty item which tasted okay, nothing to write home about. I had the cinnamon almond French toast, which didn't taste horrible but again, nothing to write home about, couldn't taste the cinnamon. In fact, I've made better French toast. I don't think we will be back.

iZts-MOqJiJnki3XMzO1uQ.text: I was mildly surprise by this place because it is a chain restaurant but they do  very good and quality food. I tried it twice in about a month and look forward to going there again. First the service is pretty quick for pretty good quality food. Second, I like again that they open early, very convenient, people here tend to sleep in I guess so hard to find anyone open before 7:00 AM.   I have to agree with one of the review, in that the biscuit and gravy is not their signature dish, but it is actually one of the best gravy if not tied for the best gravy I have tasted here in the phoenix area. It has rosemary I believe and some additional spices so it is not so bland  or just salty like almost every restaurant. It could use a little more kick to it, and you can provide that since they have like 4 different hot sauces on the table for you. The biscuit is okay, it could be a little heavier or denser, kind of too light  and airy almost like a roll instead of a real biscuit. It is well done and again, one of the best biscuit and gravy I had here in this area.   The other dish I tried was the  corn beef hash. This was probably the second best corn beef hash I have had, the other one was at red bird cafe which is closed now, so I guess it is the best that I know of that you can get. I like my corn beef has to have large chunks of beef and spices and onions etc. The only things that I can nick pick about which I do a lot is that there could be a little more kick to it and there was not that many potatoes and the beef could be seared a little, give it a little more texture and a crunch. I know a lot of people like their corn beef all broken up or smashed up to where it is like baby food, but that is the way I like mine. Again the dish is not the best I have had, but it is up there and a big step ahead of most places.   All in all, their food has quality ingredients and done very well to excellent. The down side it is a little tempered down, but by their clientele, I can see why(a lot of seniors). They are a little on the pricier side, but I look forward to trying other things on their menu.

Td7MuLBiolHZMbbSdZyIMw.text: I went to the website first to  contact them and wasn't going to yelp them.  I live close by and have been here a few times.  Every single time something is messed up.  My honest opinion is that its the management.  They need to train their employees.  Some things are not common sense.  For example during todays breakfast the waitress think her name is Michelle came over and asked the girlfriend if she wanted a refill.  Because she had basically been slow the entire meal I asked for one also mine was half full.  On the way to fill it up she stops and takes an order.  Setting out drinking on a resting table.  Common sense is that when I'm eating my meal I want to have a beverage at the same time.  And I do not want to wait for you to take an order from silver hairs which predictably  took a long time to place the order so I got up and took my drink back.  No apology.  No recognition that a mistake had been made.  Maybe she didn't realize that is not the proper way to serve a table.  Tip.  When someone flags you down while you are doing a refill tell them you just have to refill the drink and you will be right back.  So maybe things aren't common sense like when you serve potatoes.  You can't mix two batches together.  One that is crispy and another one that is raw.  You actually want to try to have your food come out consistent.  They should always be cooked the same.  Customers are not very crazy about having a few raw potatoes in every bite.  This is not the first time I have had issues at this place.  It is a cute place and they do have the best Jelly I have ever had ever. So at some point in time some one knew what they where doing.  But maybe when they setup shop in Arizona they sent out someone who was not qualified to train and open new restaurants.  I would like to believe if you go to Oregon they operate better.  I wish I could remember what some of the previous issues were. But I know it has been 6 months and mistake I tried it again.  Thing is if they cared about doing things properly they would have feedback forms in the restaurant.  And maybe a way on the website to send a message.  I'm not going to send snail mail to the corporate office to complain.  So hopefully they read this review get better management and train their employees cooks and servers.  This could be a great restaurant with a little care and TLC.  So you are warned. It's a roll of the dice if you will have a good or bad experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Biscuits Cafe - Chandler, AZ, United States. Berrys with whip cream

ULI-KFyRdrTTfHXtqnJKMw.text: We decided to eat here as my car was being serviced next door. I wanted to like this restaurant considering it is locally owned. Our server was prompt and courteous, and the food was bland. Unfortunately it was a disappointment, from being ignored when we waited to be seated to the extremely soiled floors. When we went to pay, the cashier had a difficult time processing a card transaction. I understand these things happen but rather than asking for help she continued to struggle for a very long time without acknowledging anyone in line. Just not a good experience whatsoever.

lsx_2iYr6bqaOlPsnUIWMQ.text: Came here for brunch with the fam after church. Customer service was fantastic. We were greeted warmly and sat right away. Coffee and waters came out quickly.  I was a little taken a back by the prices, with the average being $10-11 bucks, but when the food came out I understood why...the portions are HUGE. My mom and I split a meal and we couldn't even finish it.  The food was pretty decent. I got the apple chicken sausage meal. I was excited for the sausage but it was pretty bland. Pancakes and eggs were good. Potatoes were greasy and chewy, Coffee was good. My sister got one of the specialty egg Benedict's and the whole plate was covered in gravy. Didn't look appealing to me but my sister said it tasted pretty good.  I didn't like that they charged us an extra $2.50 to share a plate.  Overall, it was a good experience. I also think the decor is cozy and adorable. Quality of the food could be taken up a notch or 2 though.

IQukA6nS_hUZIrT_mgg9vg.text: One of my favorite places to eat breakfast. Every single time I've eaten here I've been completely happy. I order the almond crusted french toast almost every time. It is so delicious! My husband is super picky and always makes his order very specific and they've never had a problem with accommodating his picky orders. Their portions are great for the price.  The servers are always in good moods and attentive. I love their rewards program too because it adds up fast.

photos.caption: Photo of Biscuits Cafe - Chandler, AZ, United States. Almond crusted french toast is my absolute favorite.

TQ7lGMHWpCZJCMlHBcBddQ.text: Almond crusted French toast was delicious!! Can't wait to have it again. Nothing special about the eggs, bacon.

xZvjr-loJEwNhUo6cEbfWw.text: Great service and food.  I had the breakfast tacos which were delicious and very filling. I needed a nap after I ate them.  Highly recommend!

ihjzZbl5_ewxvHSw5xIY2g.text: Oddly, the biscuits weren't all that great, but the gravy was good. It seemed like the biscuits were the kind of standard mass produced products that you would expect at at a supermarket. I like my biscuits toasted on top and I like them to have a taste and texture beyond bland spongy bread -- especially considering this is their signature food. The biscuits were rather small considering the price -- and the gravy wasn't hot. If I didn't know better the cafe used Pillsbury dough for their biscuits. Eeek!  Overall BC is a great  place to get a meal that tastes very homemade. The red potatoes are heavenly and the french toast is about the best I have had. The coffee was good too.   The corned beef is good but I wouldn't recommend ordering this with red potatoes because the potatoes used to make the hash are very similar. You end up with a big plate of potatoes.  The eggs are disappointing. When I order two eggs I want two separate eggs, not one big round thing containing two egg yolks.  I came during off hours. The service was very good and friendly.  To me BC seemed sort of high priced, but the quality made the experience worth it.

yTqNPY84bqJF0-OwvEAfGA.text: Ugh, so disappointed. Just tried this place for the first time. We have a 2 year old son and it's not easy to go out to eat with him so we ordered breakfast to go. We had a rough morning walking out to a dead car battery and had a hectic morning. So when we got home without our full order of food, I was upset, we called Biscuits Cafe to let them know we were missing an item and they told us to back come in and get it. We live 6 miles away from this restaurant, so it's not just down the street. My husband went to the restruant and picked up the item, they didn't offer him anything complimentary for the inconvience nor did they even appoligize. This was the last thing we needed to deal with on top of our hectic morning. Unfortunately I will not be coming back here and I will not be recommending this place whatsoever.  $35 for a cold breakfast... Beyond disappointing.

PROS: Excellent service. ..fresh  homemade food  (i had the chic fried steak amazing) Delicious  homemade  jam  ..Best biscuits and gravy in valley (could almost pass as my own). The coffee is flavorful not watered down chicory. CONS: Serving portion could be your next 3 meals with a price tag to match.

_byvvElFIvA7XdnuhB8umQ.text: Thought we would check it out as we heard from a friend who works here the food is fantastic.  We are typically leary of new places but today was the day and we drove over to Warner and Dobson to Biscuits Cafe.  We didn't feel like waiting the usual wait time at another favorite location and hoped this place would be quicker.  We were seated immediately and confused as the one seating us, a server, stated she would return with our drinks and then another server came to get our drink order.  No biggie but that was the only thing quickly that happened.    There were four of us and we ordered an omelet, another omelet and two biscuit and gravy breakfasts.  Nothing special ordered.  No changes to the menu.    Literally, 45 minutes later, I asked our server if there was an issue with our meal and did we order something difficult.  She explained the kitchen was very backed up which was odd as the restaurant was NOT full with several open tables AND three tables seated well after us had already received their meals, finished them and two were just about to cash out.  Finally, at 53 minutes from the time of order, we received our food which was wonderful.  Spectacular taste, serving sizes and not cold in the slightest.  Was the wait worth it?  Not really but it was quite satisfying.  The manager comp'd our entire meal as an apology which was nice but still, I'm not sure I want to try this again.  Three stars only because of the slow meal preparation and obvious mistruth as to the reason.

ktWthI6l8icFeqPostljuA.text: I drive by this place several days each week, intrigued yes.  One would think with a name of Biscuits that would be a signature dish, wrong!  I arrived around 0900 Sunday, the parking lot about half full.  Seats were placed outside the front door,maybe a sign the food is good if there is a que. Upon my arrival the place was maybe one-third full, you could select your table with ease.  I ordered the biscuits and gravy,egg with cheese, and 2 buttermilk pancakes. The service was pretty quick,food arrived timely. But that is where the good review ends.  The butter on the pancakes would not melt, little surprise as the pancakes were like room temperature. The eggs were cold,and the biscuit and gravy same. The biscuit was like 2 inches in diameter, pretty small. The plate the meal was served on was room temp at best, maybe that contributed to the cold food and maybe there was a delay in brining my food to me.  Bottom line, terrible experience. Who likes a cold breakfast. I WONT be back.  You gotta be kiddin!!!

uZX9fVTocFDNiEkiVKW6Ag.text: Best french toast I've had in a long time!!!!! Really nice ambiance,  open, clean, friendly people. We cane at 1pm Saturday and it wast busy. Quick service and the menu has a little bit of everything on it! Can't wait to come back next brunch!!

yy9B2ElRuSEkHsGbMbVy9g.text: Wanted to try a new place out for breakfast. I remembered this place so I decided to check it out. I have to say I looked over the reviews before hand, of course, and was a little jaded by some of the bad reviews. I arrived and was greeted and seated right away. It looked like a very nice place. Small but not tiny and pretty busy. I saw on the chalkboard in front that the Blueberry Pancake Combo was featured today. I thought it was a special but saw it on the menu and realized it was just featured. So server came over and was very nice. Took the drink order. Those came back pretty quick. Then placed the food order. He was very helpful even with a very particular special order. Food came out in a timely manner and piping hot. Pancakes were a good size and very good. Blueberries were fresh. Bacon was nice and thick and just right. Eggs were done just the way I had asked. Everything was very good. Even tried one of their biscuits. How can you not when that is the name of the place and they were really good too. Pancakes really filled me up could not finish. Stuffed in a good way. Overall, I thought the food was great, service was good and fast, the prices weren't bad and the place was nice and clean. I don't understand the bad reviews unless they came on a bad day or not everyone can be pleased. Don't know but I will be back to try out some of the other stuff on the menu that looked good. It was nice to find a new place for breakfast especially after some old favorites have gone down hill recently.

photos.caption: Photo of Biscuits Cafe - Chandler, AZ, United States. Cornbeef hash with poached eggs and of course some biscuits.
Photo of Biscuits Cafe - Chandler, AZ, United States. Blueberry pancake combo. Very good. Fresh blueberries too.

RGsj-4Os2rUSYKRC7JRR2w.text: This has become my favorite place for breakfast. The patio area is very nice. I've never had to wait to eat even during peak breakfast/lunch hours. The waitresses are always extremely nice and helpful. I don't know what it is about the batter that they use to fry, but its delicious. I usually get the chicken fried steak (so good) and substitute my toast for some fruit; they give you a very substantial amount of fruit and they almost never add the $2 up charge to my bill, and if they did I wouldn't mind because they don't skimp and I know fruit can get expensive especially if substituting for bread.They also have a pretty good rewards program and when I was signing up they asked if I wanted to include any other family birthdays or special occasions to receive extra money off on those days. They definitely didn't have to do that. I've never left this place unhappy- only once were my eggs not cooked enough and she took them back immediately and replaced them with fresh ones. All in all, if you're looking for a good breakfast/lunch place I fully recommend Biscuits Cafe! (at least this location)

p_B6cFwIDMF-uyb5HaTmAQ.text: We stopped her on a whim. So glad we did! Ordered Southwest Delight - Three scrambled eggs with spicy chorizo sausage, bell pepper, onions and tomatoes with sour cream & avocado slices. SO TASTY. Also ordered Almond Crusted French Toast - Thick egg bread dipped in our egg batter & encrusted with almond-cinnamon breading and grilled to perfection.FANTASTIC! Bacon is thick and meaty and coffee is strong yet smooth. Seriously impressed with this place. Check it out.

eXlzsImNvYmd09JVM_LCGQ.text: Biscuits was recommended to me but my experience was not so great. The good: we had a very nice waitress who was prompt and helpful and the French toast was awesome! But the bacon which I asked for as "crisp," was burned, and the eggs which I asked for as "over medium" were runny and I couldn't eat them. I did not want to make a fuss in front of our daughter but I did tell the waitress when she brought the bill that, "this is not your fault" and explained the problems.

ZBkFVEKpZf5M_3-FuHjTgQ.text: Been coming here for years and they never disappoint. The service is just as good as the food and its outstanding! I love their French toast combo. And their coffee is delicious. I also use their reward system and I've gotten multiple discounts. I highly recommend biscuits for breakfast
